description:
Solid place for lunch in the city...can't really beat generous portions and reasonable prices!! My friend and I each had a noodle dish and shared an appetizer and came out to just under $30. 

The shrimp spring roll was quite good, with ample filling and thin rice paper wrapper. I was pleasantly surprised with my vermicelli as well. The five spice chicken was perfectly cooked with a great crunch. I like that they use thin vermicelli, almost like the angel hair equivalent. The sauce had great flavor too. My friend had the five spice chicken noodle soup and it was essentially the same but with broth. I tried a few spoonfuls of her soup and was rather disappointed. The broth lacked depth of flavor and a richness you normally get with pho ga (chicken pho). 

Def will be back for lunch and will still to vermicelli dishes for now and maybe try a rice dish.
author: Lynn C.

description:
If SF natives endorse this place, you know it's good! Perilla is close to my workplace so my coworker and I came here for lunch around 12PM. The place was starting to get full but we managed to get seated immediately. 

Get the five spice chicken and garlic noodles - it's what everyone else gets and it is so delicious. (Apparently the other items on the menu aren't as good as this dish) I can only describe it as "Vietnamese comfort food" because it satisfied my carb guilty pleasures. The overall portion is smaller than, say, a typical bowl of pho. However, Perilla gives a generous amount of chicken which is a good thing because the crispy chicken skin is amazing.

The service wasn't friendly but it was fast and efficient. It's perfect for diners to come in for a lunch break.
author: Michelle T.

description:
Been here for lunch a couple times with coworkers over the years and it's always good. It typically gets pretty busy around prime lunchtime, so to avoid the lunch rush I usually come a little bit earlier around 11:30 or later around 1. 

The menu is pretty straightforward. They offer your choice of protein with either garlic noodles, rice, vermicelli, or noodle soup. Entrees range between $10-12 which is pretty affordable for this area.

The garlic noodles here are pretty bomb, and I've never gotten anything else. Just make sure you take a couple extra sips of water and wash out your mouth before you go back to work, since they do load up on the garlic. 

I've had both the five spice chicken and the pork here, and while the chicken is good, the pork is definitely my favorite. It's incredibly flavorful and tender. On my most recent visit, my coworker ordered the five spice chicken, but once he tried my pork, he agreed it was tastier and said he'd start getting the pork going forward.

They prep your food fast here, so I usually get it within minutes of ordering. They're good at getting you in and out of there quickly; it's definitely not a spot to slowly eat and chat especially during their busy hours.
author: Dianna H.

description: Crispy chicken!! If you are here, order their crispy skinned juicy rotisserie chicken 4sho : ) I ordered it with a bowl of noodle soup. The chicken came on the side to keep the skin crispy. The soup was aromatic with celery, green onion, cilantro, bean sprout and fried shallot on the top.
author: Chie J.

description:
When I came here on a Tuesday for lunch, this place was packed and bustling with people. A lot of people were ordering their food to-go, so we were lucky to get seated right away.


I ordered the garlic noodles with five-spice chicken ($11). The garlic noodles were pretty good - they were flavorful and perfectly chewy. They were definitely a bit too buttery for my taste, and I felt pretty heavy after eating the entire portion.
However, I have no complaints about the five spice chicken! The skin was well-flavored and fatty, and the chicken was super tender. The chicken complimented the garlic noodles extremely well.

Considering their large portions, good prices, and flavorful food, I'll definitely be back here again for lunch!
author: Cassie Z.

description:
This place is good but it's not amazing but still goood. What I like is the food is tasty, the price is right and the portion is good. 

Service - 3
a typical Asian restaurant service. It ain't gonna be good or anywhere near top notch. Not even close. 

Food: 4 
Pretty good. I got the 5 spiced chicken with garlic noodle and fried spring rolls. The chicken was okay. My friend loves 5 spiced chicken and raved about it but I thought it was just okay-pretty good. It's just not my thing. On the other hand, I enjoyed the garlic noodle, It had a nice balance to it. The fried spring rolls were good. Nothing special but it was yummy. 

Overall, I liked it and would come back. Good for casual eating.
author: Ngoc P.

description: I was craving Vietnamese food the other day and ventured over for lunch. I'll admit - i was a little nervous it would be crowded at prime lunch hour and being so close to the sales force tower. Albeit busy, it wasn't impossible, so that was a great relief! They were quick to get my order, garlic noodles with prawns, and I took it back to the office. The garlic noodles were delicious with great texture and flavor. The prawns were good too. The broccoli was a slightly different (cooler) temperature than the other two parts - but that's just being ridiculously picky, now isn't it?
author: Katie C.

description: 2 words! GARLIC NOODLES! They are the bomb! It's a small pho restaurant, but oh man, the pho and the garlic noodles are to die for. Day dreaming about the garlic noodles
author: Angela V.

description:
When my team first heard that we were being relocated to this part of downtown, we had a few reservations, but it's safe to say we had even more reasons to be excited.  Not the least of which was the opportunity to try so many new places!  Well, for me anyways (all those years working on the Peninsula left me seriously deprived).  At the same time, it's always nice to have something familiar and comforting to turn to, especially when you're having "one of those days" at the office.  Ugh...management, amirite?!

While I'd never been to this Perilla, I've been a fan of the one by 9th Ave since the first time I tried them...and not just because they're owned by the same folks as PPQ (one of my long time, go-to spots).  Rather, it's because of their garlic noodles - they may not be the best around, but they're great!  So, when I dropped in for lunch with one of my coworkers, it was an easy call on what to order.  Although I normally get the one with BBQ pork, this time, I decided to go with the GARLIC NOODLES WITH FIVE SPICE CHICKEN ($11).

Besides how the price of my order here was slightly higher than what I typically pay over on 9th (to be expected, given the area), I thought this was still pretty solid, though not quite as good as what I'm used to from their sister location.  The chicken isn't any different by comparison (crispy skin, juicy meat, a bit oily), but the noodles didn't seem quite as garlicky or buttery as what I'm used to.  What's more, the portion size felt somewhat lighter as well, though it might be due to the flatware (these were circular, as opposed to 9th Ave's oval-shaped plates).

Without alternatives like it around, Perilla and its menu of legit Vietnamese options (including the awesome Satay Beef Pho that I always get at PPQ) are a solid choice for lunch in the area.  Steady food, fast service, and a lot more bang for your buck compared to some popular joints nearby (looking at you, Sushirrito).  The THREE AND A HALF STAR average is dead on, but if I'm being honest with myself, it's closer to three than four, especially since I can just as easily hit the one by 9th Ave.  Three stars or four though, Perilla is definitely worth checking out!
author: Mike L.

description:
I'm giving this 4 stars because it's close to where I live. You can't beat a steaming hot bowl of pho on a cold and rainy day. Get there early if you can because there's a wait but tables do turn over fast.

The pho's soup doesn't have as much depth as some places but it's still flavorful.

However the garlic noodles are the star of Perilla, and most people order it with their choice of protein.  I went with Melanie N. For lunch and she ordered garlic noodles with five spice chicken. I tried some of her garlic noodles and enjoyed it very much. It's not as garlicky as Crustacean's garlic noodles but still very tasty. She said her five spice chicken was seasoned well.

I ordered the Charbroiled Pork Vermicelli (Bun Thit Nuong) and the pork was charred perfectly.  It went well with the cold vermicelli and I love pouring the fish sauce into the bowl and mixing everything together.

I wish Perilla was open on weekends but I could see that they close because that area is a ghost town on weekends.
author: Nette T.

description:
Food is 4 stars, service is 0 star for the waiter that seated us. 

My friend and I came here during lunch time and all tables were filled. We put our names down on the waitlist. A 4-person table became empty and the waitress came by to let a single customer sit down, I thought that was nice. Then another 4-person table became empty my friend and I were next up, a different waiter let the 3-ppl party sit down first. I was about to say something when he rudely stopped me with a hand gesture and said: "WAIT HERE! There is a table finishing soon!" 

My friend and I were stunned by the move. We were both in a rush that day too and we had to wait another 15 min for the "finishing table" to actually get ready.
author: Amy Z.

description:
I work near here so I come by occasionally. Decent price, mediocre food.

I usually order one of the meats with garlic noodles which is pretty good. Sometimes the noodles can be pretty dry. The five spice chicken or pork are my favorite meat options. I tried the curry chicken and was not impressed. I feel like it doesn't pair very well with garlic noodles. The vermicelli plates are decent and you will definitely feel full after. 

The one thing that confuses me is that they only have sriracha on the table. Now for a place that serves pho (noodle soup)...where is the hoisin sauce? I also wish they had other hot sauces as well.

Tip: come here early as the line gets pretty long around 12PM
author: Allison S.

description:
Tips:
-Portions are large, enough for 2 meals. 
-GARLIC and noodles. Two wonderful things that taste amazing together. The garlic noodles here are good. Get them. 
-The beef and chicken both go well with the noodles but the beef is better imo
-Go after the lunch rush at 1/1:30 pm to get a seat faster 

I had eaten Perilla's garlic noodles through EAT Club before so I had gotten a preview of what their storefront would have: their specialty garlic noodles. We decided to have a late lunch and went around 1:30 pm. It was perfect - after the lunch rush, not noisy, and some good sunlight at the tables by the windows. We grabbed a table immediately after entering and ordered the beef and chicken with garlic noodles. 

The beef was SO GOOD. Flavored suuuper deliciously, texture was on point. Just thinking about it is making me want some right now. I usually go for chicken dishes so I ordered the chicken. It was crispy on the outside, chewy and a little fatty at some parts. Tasted like a solid dish, but the beef knocked it out of the park. If you're choosing between the two I would definitely recommend getting the beef instead. We ordered a Thai iced tea as well, but it was too sweet for my taste.
author: Saachi G.

description:
Perilla had me at chicken!   For a fast wholesome lunch meal in the city, Perilla is the place to go.

I recently was introduced to this Vietnamese noodle restaurant for a weekday lunch, and was immediately won over for its lightening fast service, clean surroundings, and of course the good noodle dishes offered.  

We were immediately seated within 30 seconds at arrival during the busy lunch hour. Our server brought our drinks and took our orders not long after.  Before I even had a chance to take more than a couple sips of my drink and set up my chopsticks, our food had arrived.   Served right before both of us were freshly prepared bowls of vermacelli noodles with our chosen side of protein.   I've only tried their five spiced chicken, which is to die for and so good that I find it hard to venture out to try something new.     On a subsequent  visit, some one else in my party ordered the garlic noodles that came with a side of broccoli and the protein of your choice.  

Depending on the protein that you choose, the noodle dishes range from a little over $10 to $12 - a doable price considering being in the heart of downtown San Francisco.  

The restaurant definitely caters towards small parties and business lunchers where most tables are set up for parties of two. There are few tables that can accommodate four, or otherwise the tables would need to be combined together for larger parties.

Service levels are adequate as the staff's primary focus is to get their customers in and out as quickly as possible.  

I'll definitely be returning for my lunchtime noodle fix!
author: Candice F.

description:
Clear your afternoon meetings after getting garlic noodles here - you'll be stinky and a bit sleepy from a heavy-ish meal. You can get a table here, but I usually head straight to the back and order to go. I enjoy most of the meat options, which have a little crisp to them - usually I order the five-spice chicken, but I also like the prawns and pork. Don't forget to pick up utensils and siracha on the way out.

The park above Proper Food across the street is a great place to sit and enjoy the pungent noodles.
author: Wing Y.

description:
I've been to this place twice in the last year or so and stayed away from reviewing it after the first visit since I dint like the food much. Everyone else I went seemed to be fans of the place and while talking with them I realized that I had ordered the wrong things.

So when we decided to visit them again yesterday afternoon, I made sure I consulted them before ordering my food. The recommendation was unanimous: Butter Garlic Noodles with Five Spice Chicken. 

The portion of chicken I got was huge and the skin was crispy (which made it so much better!). The noodles are fried with garlic/butter and you should be ready with some mouth fresheners after your meal if you care about the people around you! As for the quantity, I was full halfway through my meal and ate the second half of the meal for dinner. 2 tasty meals for $12 seems like a steal given the quality of the food at Perilla. 

Will be back ^_^
author: Gaurav K.

description: Their chicken curry and garlic noodle is my favorite!! Also five star chicken is tasty! Inside the restaurant is a little bit dark, and at around noon, they're so packed. But you can take away their foods too. Staffs are friendly and move quickly.
author: Yumiko H.

description: The shrimp is so amazing, butterflied and so tasty and well seasoned. Their rice and garlic noodles are quite great, too. They have tons of flavor.
author: Tara K.

description: I dream about their Five spice chicken. Their curry is the perfect winter food. The service is fast and friendly.  Sadly, can't eat the garlic noodles but they smell divine. The broth is light and savory. Love this place.
author: Stella K.

description: Garlic noodles and curry chicken is pretty good. I would go back. First time here. Lots of tables and very fast service.
author: Scot M.

description: This is my go-to place for garlic noodle! The five spiced chicken has a fairly crispy skin which quickly fills you up. I can never finish the whole noodle. It's tasty but given the amount of butter (processed food) in it, our body kind of naturally rejects it... considering our natural rejection and the fact I can still finish 80% of it, I'd call it amazing!
author: Isabelle L.

description:
Vietnamese girl from San Jose, working in San Francisco, so I'm on the hunt for good Vietnamese food.  

I ordered the Bun Thit Nuong Cha gio from Perilla and it just wasn't that great.  The eggrolls used the authentic wrappers, but they stuck it in the box, so by the time it got to me, it was mushy.  

Noodles were thin and hard and the fish sauce just tasted like lemons.  Meat was extra dry and flavorless.  

Between this and Miss Saigon, I'd say Miss Saigon has a better bun thit nuong bowl and better fish sauce.
author: Vi Y.

description: My boss took me here the first time and it became one of my favorite places for garlic noodle with five spice chicken & eggroll.. The wait wasn't too long during lunch time.. we were able to get seating right away.
author: Yennie L.

description:
Good Vietnamese lunch option in the area. Service is pretty quick.. Once you order, the food comes out in about 5min or less! 

I tried the Imperial Roll ($7.75) which had a crunchy, not too greasy exterior. The filling was mostly noodles with very little pork.

Five Spice Chicken Garlic Noodles ($11) was pretty good. The chicken was flavorful & moist. You can definitely taste the garlic & butter in the noodles. Good portion & filling, definitely has you thinking about taking a nap the rest of the day.

While there are plenty of tables, it does get pretty packed. Show up at 11:30am or earlier to beat the lunch crowd.
author: Ruby C.

description:
Every now and then I get an itch that few things but Perilla can scratch. I like Perilla. I like the taste of their garlic noodles, I like the broth they use for their soup, their meat is delicious, and they give you enough food to last two meals. Or one of you want to feel a little bad afterwards. It's one of my favorite feelings. "A little bad".

Ot does get crowded around noon; and more importantly, the bare walls and lack of space makes it really loud.

Noise and lack of natural light means I probably never will sit down there. But for take-out it's excellent. (I wish I could order ahead online.)

Oh, and that pork chops take quite  a bit longer than other dishes.
author: Mattis E.

description:
Perilla adds a bit of variety to this area, since there aren't many options for inexpensive Asian food, but there are a ton of cafes serving pricey sandwiches.
The menu consists of garlic noodles, vermicelli noodles, rice, and noodle soup with chicken, beef, pork, shrimp, and vegetable options. You also have your typical selection of rolls to choose from.
I've heard that Perilla is known for their garlic noodles, but I'm not one to eat an entire serving of garlic noodles. I would try the garlic noodles if it were offered as a side dish. I enjoy the flavor of garlic, but I just don't like how it lingers for so long. I have tried a couple of their noodle soup options and they are pretty good. It is a little pricey for Vietnamese food (~$10-$12), but the prices are on par with the rest of the selection in the SoMa.

$11.50 Curry Chicken Noodle Soup - w/ rice vermicelli noodles, bean sprouts, onions, cilantro:
Last time, I ordered lunch to go and my soup came in a large plastic container. The flavors of the chicken and the broth were okay. The broth was on the thin side. I could have eaten some more noodles though.

$7.75 Imperial Rolls - crispy fried rolls w/ ground pork, taro, carrots, noodles:
These were crunchy on the outside, and had a little of that mushy texture on the inside from the taro. Very tasty and very easy to eat a ton of these.

Perhaps I'll try the vermicelli options next. Cold noodles sound like a good lunch option on a warm day.
author: Joy W.

description: Went here with some Co-Workers for lunch and I was pleasantly surprised. I ordered the chicken broth pho with beef and it hit the spot. When we arrived at first there was no tables, but we only had to wait around 5 minutes or so and we got our seats. The chicken pho broth was good and mixed with some of the chili sauce really had a lot of taste. The beef was really good and mixed with the noodles it went very well. I ordered a Thai Tea as well which was nice and refreshing. I wish they had boba, but that's getting picky. Overall solid lunch spot that I will definitely visit again when I am aiming for some great pho that's very close to my office!
author: James R.

description:
Whats not to like about this place. Portion size is awesome. I wouldn't be able to finish it all myself which is awesome, saving it for dinner. Food is tasty. Not the best Vietnamese food but it's probably the best in this area. Yes, lines are crazy long during lunch hours but that's a given in the Fidi. Service is not the best but what do you expect, fast in and fast out. 

Recommended: Chicken with Garlic Noodles and their Papaya Salad. Try to go before 12pm or go after 1:30pm if you don't want to wait as long.
author: Sandy B.

description: One of the best lunch-type places I have been. Five Spices Chicken noodle soup is just delicious. Garlic noodles are good as well. The place can be overcrowded around 12pm, but they serve fast and at 1:30pm there are almost no people. As for disadvantages, I can recall only the fact that hot green tea is not for free :-)
author: Vasily S.

description:
It's a nice place to get lunch in this area, but you'll have to come in early or else the wait becomes really long.

I get the five spice chicken + garlic noodles. It comes with some veggies and a pretty good portion of chicken over noodles. The chicken is really good, tender and not dry at all. The garlic noodles are also pretty solid, not too garlicky but with just enough flavor. If you're concerned about going back to work in the afternoon with garlic breath, you can also get your entree over rice, vermicelli, or noodle soup. Aside from five spice chicken, there's also curry chicken, beef, veggies, and pork. A lot of pretty good options here for a decent priced lunch.
author: Wayne H.

description:
Lol, even with the low food safety warning, me and my coworkers still ate here. 

Beef Pho - beef was tasty and they give a lot

My coworkers got the Garlic Noodles w/ 5-Spice Chicken and the Curry Chicken Noodle Soup

Oh dangit, we forgot to order the Imperial Rolls :(
author: Linda W.

description:
Food is very good the garlic noodles and the chicken or beef are great.
How ever this place is infested with cockroaches 
I went downstairs to use the bathroom and turned the light on and a bunch of roaches ran for cover 
I will not ever come back to this place.
author: Mejia S.

description:
This place is bomb.com.

Seriously. The five-star review is for their take-out of their 5-Spice Chicken with Garlic Noodles. 

Delicious. Mouthwatering ecstasy. Every bite is welcomed with a warm, buttery sensation that make your tastebuds sing. You might gain a few pounds. Your doctor might get mad. Non-carb diet? Treat yourself.

Okay, okay. That was a bit too cheesy, but really -- it's that good! The chicken is also well-marinated and has a great crunchy texture on the outside and tenderness on the inside charm.

As far as portion goes, this place hooks you up! I can easily divide the dish into 2-3 separate meals.

If the line is long and you aren't having it, just call in an order and you'll be in and out within seconds.
author: Chinsin S.

description:
Little to no healthy options, poor food taste/quality.

The food: 
- $11.15 for Oily pan fried "five spice chicken" atop dry vermecelli and some cucumbers
- $8 for Spring rolls with frozen shrimp. would def not get again

Overall, was not pleased with my meal here and will not be coming back. coworkers were also not a fan
author: Kristie C.

description:
I've been hearing so many things about this joint and their garlic noodles I knew I needed to try them out at some point. On a given lunch date with a coworker, we saw this as the perfect opportunity. 

The place has a ton of tables but just like every other place in SF, it packs up for the lunch rush. If you get there at 11:30 or 11:45am, you'll get a table. Anything after, you'll probably wait for 15-20 minutes, not bad. Here's the good stuff. Their staff is super fast and efficient so you're in and out. 

For lunch I got their popular five-spice chicken and garlic noodles for $10.50. OH-EM-GEE, the garlic and butter sauteed noodles are on point! They give a ton of it to the order so you're left feeling super satisfied. The chicken is skin on dark meat so be advised. Fortunately enough, that's my jam so I was in heaven. The five spice was great flavoring, so just an overall win

I guess I don't have the same experiences as other people. I'm also not a food snob. I love this place and think it's super on point. This is a place I'll be frequenting for lunches to come! If you like garlic noodles, come check them out!
author: Rockne H.

description:
I was craving for some curry chicken pho since it was so cold outside. My co worker and I stumbled upon this place and decided to give it a try. Came here around 11:45AM, it was already pretty packed, but only waited for around 5-7 minutes so not bad.

Service was quick and staff were attentive, definitely hustlers. Their curry chicken pho was ok, it's not the best I had,but was decent. It had a good amount of noodles, bean sprouts and chicken. Chicken was tender so that is a plus and the curry was ok. I still prefer the chicken pho at Ben Tre, it has more of a kick to it. 

Overall, not a bad experience, I saw a lot of people got the garlic noodles, so I'll try that next time :)
author: Natalie L.

description: This is based on a to-go order that my friend got me for lunch. I'm VERY picky when it comes to noodles since I'm not a big noodle person BUT their Garlic Noodles here is f***kin' legit! I was so full but I kept on eating it and I just couldn't stop until it was gone. I had it with prawns and the sauce that it came with made it so much better. Ugh, now I'm hooked and they're only around the corner from where I work so I will be going there quite often to get my fix. I'm probably gonna try other things on the menu but so far, they got me with these damn noodles!
author: Candice J.

description: I was super vary of Yelp flagging this place was recently rated poorly for health/safety but you know asian places, B for Best haha. I've been here twice and I'd still come back if I was in the neighborhood and wanted Vietnamese food. The pho is okay, I would avoid the chicken curry (kind of watery) but the grilled pork spring roll is amazing!
author: Yvonne D.

description:
Friends and I came here on a week day (group of 4) for lunch just before 12 pm and were seated immediately. I was pleasantly surprised but shortly after, a long line of people were waiting to order for take out and be seated. 

After we were seated, we wanted a minute to take a look at the menu, but a waiter/waitress came by every 30 seconds, I kid you not, to try to rush us through our order. We had to tell 5 different people that we weren't ready in a span of a few minutes. I understand that they get busy, but this was a bit excessive.

I ordered the garlic noodles and prawns as that's the big thing here. I thought the noodles tasted great and there are definitely generous portions, but I only had about 4 or 5 smallish prawns on my plate, which was disappointing. The prawns themselves were really good as well. I would definitely recommend the noodles!

I would give them 3.5 stars if I could. The food is pretty darn good. The Thai iced tea looked good too - I'll have to order it next time.
author: Chelsea N.

description:
Great food. 
Garlic noodles are great. Good quantity of food per entree. The chicken curry was too much food for one person. 
I always get take out and it's pretty quick. But there's always a line for lunch so if you're going there to sit down it can be quite disturbing with people walking al over. 
Five spice chicken is good and so is the chicken curry. Recommend 2 entrees for 3 people.
author: Arjan N.

description: The pho here has nothing to do with Vietnamese food. It taste like wok fried beef noodles in broth. I guess if you take it humorous you may like it but it isn't worth the $13 they charge.
author: Peter B.

description: Try the curry chicken noodle soup a little spicy but AMAZING!
author: Trine I.

description: Takes awhile but the food is pretty good. Be sure to call in to order ahead of time if you're in a time. A slightly different twist to the soup.
author: Kee G.

description: The curry chicken noodle is ok. They are considerate enough to separate the noodle and curry when taking out. I should try 5 spices chicken next time!
author: Jong-Kai Y.

description: This place has SHIT service. We waited for a table for 3 for 15-20 minutes. We were next on the list and saw a table for 4 getting up. Just when we thought we were about to be seated another group of 5 was seated in front of us that had been waiting maybe 5 minutes. When we asked why they were seated before us the waiter kept saying it was because there was more in their party. Which didn't make any sense when they were seating parties of 2 at a table for 4. Rather than admit he made a mistake or that management wanted to sit them 1st for their own preference, he just went along with his incoherent reasoning. I will NEVER come back to this shit service place and will advise everyone to do the same.
author: Rachel Z.

description:
One of my favorite lunch spots but you have to go either early or late because it gets packed...and you might have to share a table with someone. 

I always get the five spice chicken with garlic noodles and an imperial roll. So tasty and great because I have leftovers for a second meal! The price point is great at about $10 a person. 

They have forgotten my meal a couple of times so if you food doesn't come out quickly, you might want to remind them that you ordered. 

The interior (and exterior) leaves much to be desired but you are going for the food, not the ambiance...
author: Wendy L.

description:
This has been my lunch go to spot lately. My coworker was the one introduced me to this place and I am HOOKED!!

I have been here enough to say their garlic noodle is pretty consistent.  I have tried it with beef, shrimp, pork, pork chop, 5 spice chicken, and curry chicken.  I would say the beef, pork chop, and 5 spice chicken were very tasty.  Shrimp was good but it wasn't enough shrimp, wish they would have provide.  curry chicken was good, but i think i would eat that with rice instead of with garlic noodle.  

their imperial rolls and spring rolls are very good.  very fresh and I can alternate between those 2 anytime.  

I have tried their rice plate with beef.  i would get that if i don't feel like having garlic noodle that day.  

i haven't tried their other noodle dish, I will try it one of this day since they look delicious.  

It's a good walk from my office, but I wouldn't mind at all since this place is very addictive.  

Their take out line is always busy, i would recommend call ahead instead of order at the counter.  

their lunch rush is always busy, so beware to wait for a table.  I would say go there after 12:30 or after 1pm.  you will get a seat for sure.  

service is ok. don't expect too much.  it is one of those restaurant where you only go there for food and not for service.  I would say they did their job.  They are always so busy, so you are lucky to get their attention right away.
author: Candice Y.

description:
BUTTERY GARLIC NOODLES!!!!! Went with my co-workers as we were all craving garlic noodles. Since it was 1:30 when we got there, the wait was only 5 mins for a table. 

This place is not super upscale, it is a place to get good garlic noodles, they bring food quickly and drops a check when you are done. The five-spice chicken garlic noodles is the best, and the pho with the chicken as a side is also good.

For $11, the portion is generous and will make one very happy.
author: Mei L.

description:
Garlic Noodles galore!! Perilla is a sit-down restaurant, but I'm usually here to order some garlic noodles with five spice chicken to go. Perilla makes my favorite garlic noodles in SF -- nice and chewy and the garlic isn't overwhelming and leaving the ire of your colleagues olfactory senses. The five spice chicken works great with the noodles and is a nice, juicy cut of thigh meat. 

I've also come for sit-down pho before, which was also good although not super memorable. The service is pretty attentive for sit-down parties despite the long line of customers ordering to go.
author: Virginia T.

description:
Two words: Garlic Noodles. 

The portions are usually enough for two meals (or 1.5 if I'm real hungry the first time around), so I don't feel too bad spending $11. 

The "seasonal veggie" version is quite hit or miss: sometimes it's just cabbage, and sometimes it's broccoli, cabbage and carrots. 

The meat versions come with a smaller portion of vegetables. The noodles are always pretty great though.

I've always gotten mine to go since the tables are all usually full when I'm there. Line's pretty inconsistent: sometimes it's slow, sometimes it's fast. Probably depends on time of day and when they have to cook up a new batch of noodles, veggies or meats. 

It is always hard to tell who is in line and who has already ordered, since there is not a lot of space to clearly delineate.
author: Krista L.

description:
Same quality food, different location. It's good to know that there's a Perilla in the Financial District and another option for lunch if needed for a good meal.

I'm always a little weary eating at a restaurant in FiDi especially for lunch, since the wait could be a while as everyone in the area usually goes out at the same time. When I came here, there was about 5 parties of people in front so my friend and I put our name down and walked to the food trucks closeby. Within 10 minutes we decided to come back and either people left, or got seated quickly. We got to sit and order right away (five spice chicken garlic noodles FTW!) Our food took a little while to come out but otherwise the quality was what I expected from their original location.

If you haven't read my other review for the original Perilla, go for the vermicelli bowls or garlic noodles!! Those are the best options here for the price.
author: Kathleen S.

description: good food and great service an amazing experiance. will definitly be coming back and bring friends with me.
author: John N.

description:
DO NOT GO HERE!!  WHERE DOES MY LIST OF THINGS THAT UPSET ME ABOUT THIS PLACE BEGIN?!
- called in my order for chicken pho, they said 10 min... sure no problem.  Its just soup that's already cooked.. you just have to package it up.  Still waited 25 min
- people who walked in their order go theirs before I did?!! WTH?
- saw the girl switch my soup container for one that had less because I complained that my order took too long.  I simply asked, "how come my order is taking so long?"
- Soup did not come with fresh vegetables.  She said they chop up everything and put it on top.  That's NOT how Vietnamese Chicken Soup is done.  I'm Vietnamese, I kinda know. 
-  Soup was oily and bland
I WOULD NEVER GO BACK HERE, EVEN IF IT IS ONLY 5 MIN FROM WORK
author: Lynda N.

description:
Perilla is a satisfactory sit-down option for Vietnamese Asian fusion cuisine. I say "fusion" because I thought five spice chicken was purely a Chinese dish! But then again, China does have a lot of influence on most Vietnamese cuisine...anyway, I digress. 

I believe they have some decent garlic noodle dishes, but being the weight conscious person I am (or trying to be), I ordered a papaya salad with beef instead. 

For a dish over $10, the size of the portions makes up for the premium price. It is chock full of various veggies, and beef was well-cooked. Their sweet fish sauce was a little too diluted and sweetened, which brought the dish down because without the sauce, it's just...flavorless. 

I'm not sure if I'd want to come back, but at least I'm glad for trying it out after walking by this place for more than a year of working in the city.
author: Viet N.

description:
I came here and had pho with my team a while back. I was craving it at the time and it really hit the spot. It's a pretty good lunch location, usually pretty busy. Service is meh, but it's a viet restaurant so I guess it's acceptable.

I also ordered pick-up for spring rolls once and they were okay. The clear noodles in them were not very good (maybe overdone?) and some of the flavors clashed a bit. They take a while to make too. I definitely prefer spring rolls from dragoneats. (and even freshrolls over perilla). I think their other noodle dishes are better though, according to my coworx.
author: Juliana P.

description:
The quick n dirty: 
Service: 10/10 (this was perfect for a 1 hour lunch break)
Food: 6/10

I went here for lunch on a normal weekday so there were a decent amount of people waiting in line for takeout, but not too many for the tables. My friends and I opted for the tables. Service was swift and we quickly ordered 3 plates of the Five Spice Chicken and Garlic noodles. 

The garlic noodles tasted like they were soaked in butter and then cooked. It was extremely salty, and did not have much garlic taste. The chicken on the other hand was amazing. Nicely spiced and cooked just enough so that it retained a good amount of juices. Not dry at all.
author: Wilson S.

description: I love coming here for their garlic noodles and BBQ beef with imperial roll.  That is probably one of the best, if not THE BEST, item on the menu.  Service could be better, I feel like I have to chase them down for water and other things, particularly one lady who is extremely rude.  Other than hat, the guys are nice...I ordered the beef papaya salad last time and it was good.
author: Jill P.

description: While their food is amazing, their cleanliness is not.  I rested my forearms on the table while having a conversation and was disappointed at how they stuck to the tables.  So I ran my napkin on the table and it was covered in dirt & grease.  I live this place but I will quit you if you don't clean up!
author: Sunshine B.

description:
This location is around the block from my Company and I can only resist their delicious garlic noodles for so long. I was treated to birthday lunch here by some awesome coworker/friends of mine and we ordered take-out. They are always slammed after 11:30am so try to get here at least 10 minutes earlier to get a table, no guarantees though! The lunch crowd swarmed in and the line was out the door before we knew it. There is no set aside waiting area for take-out so you have to stand awkwardly by the cashier waiting for your food to come out. The pricing is decent and I think fair for the amount of food you get. I ordered the noodle soup this time, I was sick from a flu of sorts, and the broth was exactly what I needed in my life. I opted for the spiced chicken, which was slightly greasy and not cut into small chunks for the soup, which I was happy about cause it was crazy moist! 

Their Thai Iced Tea is bomb too!
author: Constance D.

description: I see some bad reviews, but I've here twice the last two weeks and it's been consistent and the place is always clean. First time Garlic Noodles w/5 spice chicken  + imperial toll and second garlic noodles w/ pork chop + imperial roll. Each time was good, but I think they need to improve their imperial roll, little too dry over fried and could use more filling.
author: tommy c.

description:
Went here for the first time with some coworkers during lunch. We ordered takeout, so this review won't be useful for someone looking for a dine-in rating.

Ordering: Ordering my food was relatively painless. I chose the chicken curry garlic noodles, as I had heard only good things about the noodles. Waiting for my food was another story. It seems like the whole group of people I ordered with (except one other who ordered the same) received their meals before me even though we ordered together. Normally, this wouldn't be an issue, but people after us were also receiving their meals to go before me. The noodles came in a cardboard box, and the curry comes in a small plastic container (smart on their part).

Food: Once I was able to taste the actual food, I almost thought the wait was worth it. The chicken curry wasn't as spicy as I was hoping, but it had a great taste. Large portions for noodles, and big chunks of chicken and potatoes were in the curry. I would definitely order it again if I go to eat at the restaurant, but probably never again for takeout.

I will probably re-review this business once I've been able to sit down and have a meal there.
author: Rajeev S.

description:
This place is awful - I'm always open to hole in the wall places, but this was bad from start to finish. Granted this place gets super packed, so that adds to the chaos and is out of the restaurant's control, and the lady at the cash register was super nice.

They ran out of vegetables at lunch hour, and I was with 2 vegetarians. My friends ended up eating tofu with rice, and the tofu was soggy and bland. I ordered the vermicelli soup with chicken, and the soup was completely bland and oily - no flavor at all - and the chicken was mostly fat. There are so many great options in the area - I know this place is known for its chicken and garlic noodles, but it was disappointing to have such bad food, after such a long wait.
author: Jenn H.

description: I go here for the five spice chicken. Just learned they opened up another location in the East Bay :)
author: Ron D.

description:
Best dish I've had so far is the 5 spice chicken garlic noodles, which are delicious! 

I've also tried the chicken vermicelli, which was average. 

Service is pretty quick here to accommodate the large lunch crowd in FiDi.
author: Brittney B.

description: I have tried going to Perilla a couple of times and both times I ended up leaving because the line was too long. This only made me more determined to eat there. Finally got a chance this past week when I was doing a late lunch with a friend. Ordered the Imperial Rolls aka deep fried goodness and the garlic 5 spice chicken aka yummy. Now I understand the long lines and I will  be back.
author: Sunil R.

description: Sour face service and hair in my food. Asked for an extra plate and got a dirty one with grease on it. I won't come back.
author: Suzy Q.

description:
You can't beat garlic noodles with five spice chicken for lunch in this area, unless you have people to see...then the garlic taste wouldn't do you well with the smell from your mouth!

This Perilla is unlike the one on Irving!  Their Vermicelli noodles for the soup bowl was not the typical rice noodle texture that is expected in pho bowls.  It was more of a Cantonese styled spinoff of it as well as their broth that they used.  Plus, they didn't serve up the typical veggie plate that you ideally put in pho bowls.  I was not expecting this type of noodle soup - especially from my previous experience at the Perilla on Irving.  As for their 5 spice chicken, it had a nice, crisp texture.

It was about $12 with tip for a good lunch meal.  However, the soup left my mouth dry.  Probably from all the hidden MSG.

This Perilla was lacking decor, energy and a bit of quality to the meal.  It is a good fix, but not the best!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
So far I tried garlic noodles with vegetables and prawns here. Vegetables felt like they were left overs from other dishes. Prawns were OK. I like the noodles.

I think overall food is subpar and they have ridiculous wait times for certain items (garlic nood with prawns). I don't think it is worth the wait.
author: Cem A.

description:
first impressions while eating

Spicy Chicken Curry Temperature is Burning hot but not spicy at all.

garlic noodes are awesome

Not sure how to eat them together due to separate containers 

Curry container does not protect from heat. cant pick it up at all.
 
holy crap the garlic noodles are good

Now that the temp dropped, curry broth is amazing. still not spicy but delicious. 



final impression. 13.33 is what i paid and everything , even though presentation and temperature weren't very good, was delicious and the proportion was good. even for a giant like myself.

will eat here again.
author: Randy P.

description:
Garlic noodles are still deliciously garlicky! Stopped by for to-go and they were ready in 5 mins.

However...waiting for a Vietnamese iced coffee took 15 MINUTES. I appreciate them making it fresh but that is too long for to-go. It was over-iced and too small for the price. Sticking with Tart to Tart for my Viet coffee needs.

But definitely coming back for more garlic noodles w/ 5 spice chicken!
author: Bonnie Z.

description:
Good, decent Vietnamese place for lunch.

I got the pork chops, which were cooked well and were flavorful. The garlic noodles were disappointing.  They lacked flavor, except for the areas that had sauce poured on them. The sauce is watery though, so it ended up pooling on the bottom, which is where the flavorful noodles were.

Overall a good place to grab lunch with coworkers. I would go back again.
author: Jaching H.

description: When my friend told me Perilla had the "best garlic noodles," I thought she was kidding. She wasn't. The garlic butter noodles are made fresh and extremely tasty; the closest I have had to them before was at Thanh Long in SF. I ordered the garlic noodles with pork chop, and even the pork chops were juicy and delicious! I would recommend coming here during your lunch hour if you work in the area. At $13 a plate, it is well worth it! We came at 1:00 pm and it was still busy, but we were seated right away. Based on that, I would wait to take my lunch a little later to avoid the rush.
author: Monica M.

description:
2.5 STARS

I read perilla is owner by PPQ so it comes as no surprise the garlic noodles seemed to be identical - garlicky and perfectly al dente - delicious! I'm surprised at how mediocre the ratings are on Yelp for such a gem in Fidi where there are few affordable OR quality vietnamese spots. 

The line gets pretty long around noon but moves fast. It's loud, so I wouldn't recommend it for a business lunch. The prices are affordable and the food was quality. 

Having tried a couple things I would recommend the five spice chicken because it was tender flavorful and crispy on the outside. The grilled pork was nothing special. The menu offers several appetizers, a selection of alcoholic and non alcoholic beverages (vietnamese coffee yum!), and noodle or rice plates served with your choice of meat or veggies. 

Vietnamese Coffee ($3+): Ordered to go today. I like that they are not premade so you can control the amount of condensed milk added. They were nice about it!

I did not like the chicken noodle soup (bland and they use Chinese noodles instead of pho). I wouldn't say it's a place to seek out especially since its closed for dinner, but if the trek to outer sunset isn't convenient for you I would highly recommend Perilla for lunch! Can't wait to come back.
author: Jess C.

description:
Perilla's garlic noodle lunch is probably one of my favorite break time comfort foods in FiDi! The noodles and ingredients are always piping hot, [super unhealthy], and deliciously flavored! 

A lot of the working class gather here between 12pm-2pm, so it's often nice to order the food to-go 15 minutes in advance, pick it up, and eat in one of the many public spaces San Francisco has to offer.
author: Stephen D.

description: EXTREMELY BAD experience! I ordered in through seamless for delivery and they had a shortage of drivers! Since it was an hour since I had placed the order I called the restaurant and a lady picked up was super rude and mentioned my order was on the way and hung up on me! 20 mins later when the order had not arrived I called again and this time a gentleman picked up and said oh order has been ready but nobody has picked it up! I guess they don't consider it important to at least inform the customer or seamless!!!! I had to call seamless and cancelled the order!
author: Sudie G.

description:
Good lunch option.
I've only ever got the garlic noodles, so far my favourite meat is the beef.
author: Jr P.

description:
I don't know if you can even call this Vietnamese food.  Last I checked, noodles loaded with garlic and butter were never part of the Vietnamese diet.  But hey, whatever, they're crack like everyone says.  Got it with the five spice chicken, crispy and tasty just as I was hoping for.

Also overpriced, but what in SF isn't overpriced?  I just find it hilarious that just because it's in FiDi, it's $3 more than if I had went to their other spots in Sunset or Richmond.

Came here at like 1 PM, so no line.  Been said enough times, but I'll say it myself.  If you come here between 11:30 AM to 1 PM, expect a line.  I got work to do, so I don't got time for no line!
author: Alexander Y.

description:
Of course, once I leave the Sunset, I have all sorts of Asian food cravings.

This week's craving: garlic noodles. After browsing through Yelp to see where I could possibly talk my sister into eating for lunch that had garlic noodles on the menu, I came across Perilla. 3.5 stars is usually pretty decent. A look through the pictures and I was sold. I'm a big fan of hearty, thick noodles and the coloring on the garlic noodle pictures looked promising.

I was able to convince my sister that walking all the way from Bush Street to 1st and Mission to have lunch was totally doable all within her 1 hour lunch break. I may have been stretching it a bit, but I think she really did make it in on time! 

Service: There was a guy waiting at the door when we entered so we were seated immediately and handed ice waters. He was also at the ready with his notepad so once we were ready to order, he was right by our table side! About 5-10 minutes later, our food was delivered. This gave us plenty of time to eat our food and talk without being super rushed. Additionally, when we were finishing up, the a lady appeared with our check! Quick and efficient. Although at any other time I might have felt rushed, this time the speedy service was welcomed!

Food: I ordered the veggie garlic noodle plate and my sister ordered the five-spice chicken garlic noodle plate. I wasn't sure what kind of veggies to expect, but really all I wanted was some solid garlic noodles. What I came out with was a bunch of sautéed cabbage mixed in with mushrooms and some other items. It was definitely oily and lacked flavor, but it was served with a side of chili sauce that helped a bit. The garlic noodles were the perfect texture and had a chewiness I could appreciate. The flavor was more buttery than garlic, though. I think everything was so rich that I filled up quickly and had to take nearly half of it home with me! My sister seemed to like her dish and she finished it up all except one slice of chicken and her single piece of steamed broccoli.

Price: After 6 months of living in SOMA, I've come to accept the fact that there will be no more cheap Asian food down the block from me. All food will have to be carefully selected (thank goodness for Yelp) and elevated prices are to be expected. At $10.50 + tax and tip for each of our lunch plates, this was definitely a bit steep for a carb-based meal. However, I think it killed off my garlic noodle craving for awhile now.

Will I return? Probably only in the instance that I'm desperate to satisfy another garlic noodle craving and I can't make my way back to my old stomping grounds: the Sunset.
author: Leana L.

description:
Yay for 5 spice chicken with garlic noodles.

Also tried their rolls and they are good.

Lunch time crowd will test your patience so arrive early.


Ambience is casual and service is ok!
author: Nelce S.

description:
Summary: It tastes a lot like watered down Vietnamese food, but the five spice chicken is tasty.

I came for a quick workweek lunch with friends. We hopped in around 12:15 and fortunately got a seat after waiting 5 minutes and managed to make it out by 1. The menu is mostly structured around carbs (vermicelli, rice, noodle soup) and 'proteins' (chicken, shrimp, beef, veg, etc). The chicken was cooked perfectly with a crispy slightly sweet skin. The rest of my dish (vermicelli with chicken) was rather bland and boring. The sauce didn't add much and there were too many noodles to veggies. This might appeal to someone looking to put a foot into Vietnamese cuisine but cannot hit the spot for someone who is accustomed to it. The price point was nice for a sit down in the city though given nearly every lunch will set you back at least $10.
author: Tammy T.

description: Despite the mediocre yelp score,  this place came recommended by afriend. The food was great (we had garlic noodles and Vermicelli noodles,  both with pork), there was no wait at 1 p.m . during the week and service was great.
author: David S.

description:
Good:
- They have very good service and they work very fast.
- Their food is as good as the other location at sunset.
- Tried their Chicken Curry with Garlic Noodle  this time and it was amazing! Totally recommended.

Not so good:
- Prepare to line up outside, specially during lunch time. All financial area comes down to eat at lunch so it will be packed.
author: H C.

description: Bomb.com garlic noodles. If u go during work day, those noodles portions can be split to two meals. First lighter (but sufficient) meal will prevent a food coma, but bring the joy that a salad does not.
author: Joseph L.

description: not too good. I've had better phos in San Jose.
author: Maria M.

description:
Service was pretty slow and bad.  Brought out our plate which was both dirty.  He took it back and another guy brought us plates, which turned out to be the same dirty plates from the first time.

The garlic noodles were really good however the lamb chops were too salty from the heavy sauce.  Lunch time gets super packed so be prepared to wait.  

Will go again and try another dish.
author: Erica C.

description:
I love garlic noodles and I love Perilla - minus one star because it is kinda pricey.. but then again... we are in FiDi so.. jk I added back the one star for 5 stars!

Their noodles are to die for in its heavily buttery, oily richness and coupled that with the five spiced chicken... I am just salivating thinking about it. I've gotten both the pork and the beef at the same time but it's just simply not as seasoned as the five spiced chicken... Generous portions and not cheap but will def. fill you up 1.5 times with the extra side of huge broccoli cutlets (their attempt to be healthy... ha ha...).

Okay but anyways, yes don't get the pho (DO NOT!) and the papaya salad is decent but the clear winner is def. the five spiced chicken with garlic noodles! Enjoy!

Fun fact: this place seems like it's only opened on the weekdays and PPQ Dungeness Island actually own it!
author: Vanessa K.

description:
Stopped by hoping a little pho would clear up my sinuses.  The curry chicken noodle soup did the trick!  Perfectly seasoned, plenty of flavor and heat.  In fact, my throat begged for a sip of Thai Iced Tea after a couple bites.  Walked in early (11:20 Monday) and had no problem finding a seat.

I didn't feel my dish was missing anything.  But for those who might want more, each table has a fresh bottle of siracha.  Will definitely return!
author: Mark C.

description: Like almost everything in the financial district, the food was average, bland, and overpriced. I ordered the beef soup in chicken broth, and to be honest I should have probably known it wasn't gonna be a good idea. The most I can say about it is "meh." $12 gets you watery, seasonless chicken broth, flavorless noodles and bean sprouts, and some grilled steak. I'll hand it to them, the steak was pretty tasty and grilled nicely, but the flavor of grilled steak in a soup is like ???? And using chicken broth for a beef soup is like ???? It looks like everyone else orders the five spice chicken and garlic noodles, so maybe that dish is a better (and more delicious) bang for your buck, but I'd have to say the soup was definitely underwhelming.
author: Casey C.

description:
If you don't like garlic, don't come here. Everyone else: come here if you don't have any important meetings for the rest of the day. Or chew some gum.

The garlic noodles are greasy, flavorful, and delicious. The strong garlic taste goes really well with the barbecued meat. There's all kinds of meat options to choose from to go with your noodles, and you'll also get a few sprigs of broccoli (I said it was delicious, not healthy!). There's an unidentifiable sauce (maybe fish sauce) that comes with the noodles. Pour it over your noodles to round out the garlic flavor.

I'm pretty sure there's other stuff on the menu, but everyone orders the garlic noodles for a reason. This place gets pretty packed during lunch time, so come early or plan to get your noodles to-go if you're in a rush.

Finally, I'll repeat it again: bring some gum!
author: Brittany C.

description: safety masks, gloves! clean clean clean! when they prepare your food! the best most reasonable food! garlic noodles is a must! huge portions!!!! our company always uses this place for luncheons! they say everything is fabulous! so order up. you wont be disappointed
author: Mrs D.

description: Garlic noodles are bomb af. Will come eat here again cause bro those noodles are bangin!!! Dude but seriously. Buttery goodness all over the face. It was that bomb af. Much love to the staff ya'll out here for me and I respect it.
author: Mike H.

description:
This is my new favorite place to order take out for work! 

WORD OF ADVICE FOR FAST SERVICE: Order take out!

I'm pretty busy at work and don't have the time to wait to be seated for 30 minutes. So this place is awesome when it comes to take out. Most people in SF's FiDi know this because the take out line is always long, but fast. 

I ordered the garlic noodle with pork. The garlic noodle was so freakin delicious, I didn't care if my breath smelled bad afterwards (actually I did because I had to eat a few mints right afterwards). lol. But their pork was well seasoned and the sauce was awesome. It was pretty good with siracha too. The portions are big here. So I was able to have it for lunch and dinner.
author: Josephine C.

description:
Their garlic noodles are awesome. It doesn't even matter what you put in them. Best one in my opinion is the pork, but the five spice chicken is also really good.

It's pretty hard to get a table during lunch time, but the worst part about this business is that they only open 4 hours a day, and only weekdays! I really want to come here on the weekends, why would you do that!?
author: Antonio H.

description: I ordered the garlic noodles with five spice chicken and it was so damn good. Probably one of the best garlic noodles I've ever had. The garlic noodles had the perfect amount of garlic to it, and the chicken was crispy. I didn't expect the portion to be huge! I also loved their thai iced tea because it's not too sweet :) I suggest coming to this place before noon because that's when it gets crowded. I enjoyed my meal but I have to knock off 2 stars because my cousin found a piece of hair in her garlic noodles :( So gross and disappointing! I felt bad for her.
author: Tiffany T.

description:
My good friend who is also a foodie introduced me to this place. She is Vietnamese, so I know should would know her stuff. 

In a nutshell? This place makes great, quick, delsih vietnamese food in the Financial. The dish prices are really reasonable for the Financial District lunching scene. 

I always get their tofu spring rolls, which are so good and fresh! And for my main dish I always either get the veggie garlic noodles or the veggie rice noodle dish. It just depends if you want something rich and heavy "my boss is driving me crazy today I need some good comfort food" (garlic noodles!) or "keeping it light, I am hitting the gym after work don't need the nom nom sleepy food coma this after noon type deal" (rice noodles!). 

My meat eating friends vouche for the pork or five spice chicken garlic or rice noodle. They say their rockin' dishes.  I haven't tried their soups yet, but they certainly look good. Definitely a try on one of those "It's kinda cold here in SF today, I feel like soup, but not just ordinary soup, want a little spicy yo!" days:) 

Little tip: they get packed at lunch hours, since it is small. I suggest trying to get their by 11:30am to avoid waiting for a sit. Otherwise, you can do online or phone order, and do a talk out. especially on a nice SF where you can eat outside!
author: Sonia A.

description:
Portions are too small to justify the price. My Papaya Salad with Shrimp for $10.25 should've consisted of more than 3 whole shrimps cut into halves, in my opinion. It looks like a heaping pile in the picture but don't let that fool you. I was left hungry and must consume my emergency Cheetos.

Fish sauce was off, too. It had too much regular fish sauce in a bottle without enough lemon and sugar to give it a more rounded flavor. Not trying to be picky but fish sauce is not supposed to taste like that. Just sayin'.
author: Julie L.

description:
This is a good place to get tasty, simple and inexpensive Vietnamese food for lunch.  Because I have only ever had lunch here, I am not sure if they have dinner service.  Perilla offers a variety of proteins (prawns, chicken, porkchops and beef) that you can mix with a carb (garlic noodles, vermicelli or rice).  I love the garlic noodles, with pretty much anything else - but they do tend to be a bit greasy.  The porkchops are also very good, but again, also a bit greasy.  The place is clean and unadorned, but you do not go to Perilla for ambience.  Instead, you go for some flavorful (albeit sometimes greasy) lunchtime goodness.

This place tends to get really crowded at noon, so I would suggest coming in a little earlier or later.
author: Theresa C.

description:
This place is good......if you don't mind the roaches.

I was sitting next to the bathroom sign. While I only saw one roach coming in and out of the wood panel, I saw several little antennas sticking out of the same panel. Cute. 

But hey if you don't mind, I would recommend that you thoroughly check your food and the container that holds the chopsticks. I am not the only yelper that has encountered them. Luckily not in my food.
author: Cindy C.

description:
Best vietnamese garlic noodle house in and anywhere near the Fidi. 

Now that I've tried the five spice chicken and garlic noodles I can comfortably give this place 4 stars. The chicken is tender and the noodles were al dente accompanied by just enough vegetables to not feel guilty about eating everything on the plate. The imperial rolls are small but freshly made so they had that nice crunch to the outside. The only drawback is that the vietnamese iced coffee that came out premade and didn't have any strength to it. 

To sum up the noodle plates are good here and so are the imperial rolls however I would not order the vietnamese iced coffee again. Expect a line if you arrive around noon.
author: Norris T.

description:
GREASY DELICIOUS 
(4 stars) 

FiDi + lunch hour = good 

-FOOD, rice plates are yum 
-PRICES, decent
-SERVICES, fast
-AMBIANCE, small 

Treated here for lunch by my new teammates on my first day. We ordered a lot and did family style. Sorry no pictures to share, I didn't want them to think I was weird going all crazy with food porn snapping. Their portions are good here when you get the rice plates for lunch. I've had pho here long ago and I do not recommend the pho.

HEFER STATS. 

GARLIC NOODLES - greasy but so good. Thick noodles drenched in garlic flavor. You will definitely need a couple breath mints after. 

CHICKEN CURRY - there curry was actually really good. I'm very very picky with any yellow curries but this one surprised me and I was pretty satisfied. 

LEMON GRASS BEEF - I rarely eat beef so when you see me go down on the beef, it has got to taste really good. Tender thin sliced beef stir fried with lemon grass, great flavor. 

IMPERIAL ROLLS - typical and always yummy. 

VEGETABLES WITH TOFU - it was like stir fried shredded cabbage with pieces of tofu. I expected this to be light but it really wasn't. It was good... And also it was greasy. 

Will I be back? I think so. It's just kitty corner from the office 

UNTIL THE NEXT REVIEW....
author: Jane A.

description:
Tried the Five Spice Chicken and Garlic Noodles today.  
Went during lunch hour and the crowd was ridiculous! I highly suggest ordering beforehand and picking it up at the counter.  If you do that, you still have to fend your way to the front to pay, but they have your food ready within 5 minutes.

The garlic noodles were good.  They're light and garlicy with not too much oil.  The chicken was good too but I didn't think it was so amazing that I would come back again.  The broccoli was gross - no taste!
author: Kristin C.

description:
Come here for the garlic noodles, I assume. I didn't get to try it, but every worker's shirt promoted it, and everyone who came to pickup lunch ordered it. Must be good, I'd come back to try it.

The pho on the other is 3 stars. The noodles and broth is 1.5 stars pretty bland and boring, but the five spice chicken on the side is 4.5 stars and excellent flavors. It's $11 though, very pricey, but I don't blame them as it's the FiDi and it's ridiculously packed for a table (30-45 min wait for groups of 4+ it seems). 

My friend's $11.50 yellow curry with rice noodles was bland as well.

Service is a bit slow too.

I'll come back when i'm hungry for garlic noodles, likely to go/pickup, but I doubt i'll be back for pho or the long line.
author: Chuck N.

description: Food is nice but I wish the portion was larger because it's kind of pricy for the amount of food they give you. I would recommend this place for dining in but not take out.
author: Dennis T.

description:
Came here for lunch at around 1 pm on a Friday, the wait wasn't too bad. I think servers are very quick on their feet since they are aware it is the lunch rush. My friend told me about the garlic noodles & I got the pawns garlic noodles. My friend got the 5 spice chicken one. 

I really like their garlic noodles because they are on a drier end (the good way). A lot of places make them really saucy or thick. Thai tea was a good pairing with the noodles!
author: Lingyee W.

description:
The service was great...but the Pho was so BLAND that it was like drinking hot water with noodles. I didn't even finish it. 

The Imperial rolls were similarly tasteless, but not greasy.

It was just very, very, very bland...
author: Jonathan D.

description:
What can I say. The garlic noodles. Want to taste something heavenly and makes your breath smell? This is the place. Seems like garlic noodles are a thing here in SF.

Perilla is a great place for your work lunch needs.

PRO TIP: Order beforehand and then go pick it up. Saves you SO much time from waiting in the large crowds of people.
author: Joanne W.

description:
I've walked by Perilla many times.  Last week I checked out the menu in the window and peaked my head in.  The place looked busy as it was lunch time however the waitress waved me over to a table.  I ordered the Five Spice Chicken and Garlic Noodles and went to reading my newspaper. The food came out quickly.  The good portion of chicken was barbecued, very moist and tasty, but the noodles were sensational.  Now they weren't as good as the Garlic Noodles that Thanh Long makes, but for $11 for lunch, they were mighty fine especially in that neighborhood where a salad will set you back $15.  They also do take out orders.

Perilla is a great economical place to have lunch.  They have you in and out in a half hour and they don't take too much bite out of your wallet.  What more can you ask?
author: Nick C.

description: Huge fan of the garlic noodles! I came around 11:45 and waited around 10 minutes for a table. Once seated, the food comes out really quickly. The garlic noodles are perfectly buttery and chewy, and tastes great with the five spice chicken. The chicken was delicious as well, the skin was crispy and the meat was tender. The portions are really big as well, especially for only $11. I'd definitely come back for more!
author: Kathleen H.

description: Pretty simple: found a roach in my vermicelli bowl. They took it off the bill, but it was still pretty disgusting. I won't be back for sure.
author: Winst D.

description:
My company catered this place for lunch today and it was awesome! I am a fan! 

We had the garlic noodles with chicken, garlic noodles with pork, beef and rice, tofu and rice and eggrolls. Everything was tasty and awesome but my fave was the garlic noodles with pork. It definitely had the most flavor. 

This is real comfort food, lots of great spices. Everyone in the office has been raving about how great it is. I will definitely be checking out this place more often at lunch!
author: Dusty N.

description:
Overall: Big portions. You leave here happy knowing you'll be full and satisfied. I'll be back again for more noodles and chicken! 

Food: I ordered the Five Spice Chicken Vermicelli and it was worth every penny.  I wished I they had the imperial rolls with the noodles, but I guess it comes extra now.
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
This place is pretty consistent. The garlic noodles are popular here - I'd say it's pretty decent. I liked the imperial rolls a lot.

The meat (chicken/pork/beef) that goes with the noodles are a little too oily and fatty for my taste, so I order it with the shrimp. They'll give you 5 pieces of shrimp, 3 pieces (seriously) of broccoli, and a mountain of noodles for $13+. Pretty expensive but when you're in the mood for lots of carbs, you're in the mood.

Decent place in FiDi.
author: Cookie M.

description:
So delicious and a place I always walk by but never noticed enough to step in. I met a friend during a work lunch hour and this place was great. I could tell it was good because as soon as you enter there's a bit of a wait about 8-10 min at like 12:30ish and this fell on a Tuesday. We got quickly seated and they ask for your order and bring food out fairly quickly to accommodate  the lunch crowd. 

Both my friend and I ordered the five spice chicken vermicelli which was very good and huge!! The portions were massive at least for me and I basically took home an entire takeout box full and ate it for dinner. Not bad at all! My friend whose a guy also ordered the same thing but finished it so I think for a guy it's what they would eat. 

I read a couple yelp reviews and everyone kept mentioning the five spice chicken which was very tasty not oily and had a really authentic flavor. There were other items I would like to try but didn't want to go too heavy at lunch!

It's right next to Portico which I'm at all the time! Good find I'd def go back. Better for a work lunch with 1-2 ppl bc it's a small place!
author: Priya S.

description:
Ok ok, so it's not 100% Authentic Vietnamese.  I don't care.

Garlic noodles are carbs with saltly, buttery, and galicy godliness.  I would nom perfectly chewy garlic noodles all day.  Nobody would come near me because I would have eaten a whole head of garlic, but I'd be ok with that.  Garlic noodles are great with the grilled pork or grilled shirimp, or five spice chicken.  All meats are moist and well seasoned.  But you won't care what meat you get because you will be like "ZOMG WTF BBQ?! What is this amazing garlicy carby goodness in mah mouth?!"

On the down side, the fresh spring rolls are pretty expensive for not that much spring roll.  2 small rolls for $7.  I'd rather spend $2 more and get big ones from Out the Door at the ferry building.  Also, the noodle soups are ok but nothing super special.  But I don't care.  Because GARLIC NOODLE!

Perhaps it's that I've been on a reduced wheat, super nutrient dense, and fibrous food kick in prep for summer and a trip to Maui with my man---but the thought of garlic noodles is more appealing than the millions dollars I didn't win in the Powerball jackpot right now...actually...I'll take the millions of dollars.  And buy THOUSANDS OF GARLIC NOODLES!!! MUAHAHAHAHA!  Nobody will care I'm fat because I'll be rich. Wooooo!!!
author: Susan C.

description:
Typical of Asian restaurants, a server took our orders with minimal comments and came back with two heaping bowls of soup.

I ordered the noodle soup with five spice chicken. The chicken broth was rich but not overpoweringly so, with a hint of basil and green onion. It's notable that the chicken came separately outside the soup to preserve its taste and texture, and I enjoyed the spiced skin. Unfortunately, the skinny noodles were not very firm and had a forgettable mouthfeel from being too soft.

3 stars: an average experience at an average price ($11) with an average amount of food for a noodle soup place.
author: Steven L.

description:
This is often raved about at the go-to garlic noodle spot of my office and now I know why!

Pros:
- lots of garlicky goodness amid lightly browned noodles
- the beef (lemongrass teriyaki) was lean and tender
- some bonus broccoli pieces
- ps: other coworker recommendation= 5 spice chicken 

Cons:
- very loud atmosphere with limited seating/standing room during lunchtime 
- would pass on the veggie summer rolls next time- dry and bland
author: Stephanie T.

description: Thanks for making me a happy Jew!  Good food and fast.
author: David F.

description:
Garlic Noodles. Give me more please! 

Another quick lunch spot in the FIDI district. I normally get the garlic noodles with either pork or beef and have yet to be disappointed. This is actually the first vietnamese place I ever ate at and started my love of vietnamese food! 

It's a rather basic meal, but its incredibly filling and rather cheap! Also the portions are pretty generous which is nice. 

Tips:
-Very loud, so wouldn't recommend for intimate dates or for really having any sort of conversation.
-Rather limited seating, so plan around the usual lunch time rush
-Order for pickup in order to be able to enjoy the yummy noodles somewhere else.
author: Sami F.

description: I can't help but order the 5 spice chicken and garlic fried noodles every time I come to Perilla- it's just that good and the portions are big. Their app rolls are delicious. Try the imperial rolls- fried to perfection. If you want something lighter try the shrimp rolls- very fresh with a good peanut sauce to go with it. During lunchtime be prepared to put your name down on the list and wait a few minutes- they're fast so you'll still be back to the office in plenty of time.
author: Julie Z.

description: Good stuff. Had takeout noodle soup with 5 spice chicken. Togo is very quick. It was filling and not too salty but also nothing I would rave about, either. Hits the spot if you're in a soup mood. It was 12 for my soup.
author: Alyssa J.

description:
Just sat down, Lo and behold Water glass is dirty.

Lost my apetite...I loved tis place till now.   :-(.

I come here for the Garlic Noodle.  Service is quick...but sometimes too quick that they dont check the dishes.

We just cant beleive they got sloppy. Check the picture I posted.
author: SFoodie P.

description:
Some coworkers like Perilla a lot so I have been here a few times now and tried the chicken garlic noodle, and beef rice, both are tasty, although I think Perilla is more famous for its noodles.  

Expect a very long line during weekday lunch hour, or you can order to go and it is a lot faster!
author: Cheng C.

description:
A bit expensive for Viet food, but hey, considering the location, it should be expected.

I like this place because, depending on what you decide to order, you can have a relatively healthy, filling meal. I highly recommend the Pork Spring Rolls--the meat is marinated and grilled well, and it's wrapped with some vermicelli noodles, lettuce, and bean sprouts, with fish sauce supplied as dipping sauce. One order isn't going to fill you up though; I usually get two--one for light lunch and one for a late afternoon pick-me-up.

Another go-to is the charbroiled beef over rice. It's actually a pretty generous portion of beef, and holy crap, do they give you a lot of rice. I'm talking 2.5-3 cups worth of rice (which I never eat, but hey, it's worth mentioning because it's a lot of rice, and rice is filling). 

Never had the garlic noodles, which seem to be very popular here, because I need to be able to mentally function at work after lunch. 

Anyway, Pork Spring Rolls and Charbroiled Beef. And if their sister restaurants are any indication, the grilled pork chop over rice with a fried egg should be pretty good too.
author: Evelyn C.

description:
The portion of Garlic noodles was huge but bland :( Quality over quantity I always say. 

Five spice chicken didn't have that nice crisp I was looking for either. It was rather dry, in my opinion. 

Thai iced tea was luke warm with no ice... I did mention that it was ICED TEA, right ?

In short, I like the Irving location a lot more.
author: Anh T.

description:
Came here for lunch for our weekly Pho Monday's trip. Decided to try something closer to work since we all had a busy day so Perilla was the pick of the week. Their lunch hour is packed, with a line, which of course is always to be expected anywhere during lunch hour. We had our name on the list but I think we waited 30+ min to get seated. Given that people were eating slow and just chillin' and there was just one guy going around picking up checks and checking on people. The place is also small so it was a bit cramped for all of us who were waiting on a table to stand around. When we finally got seated we ordered quickly. I ordered the Curry Chicken Noodle soup, it looked delicious to me from the photos, while my friends ordered the 5 spice chicken noodle soup. 15 min later our food came and we started slurping away. My Curry Chicken Noodle Soup wasn't as flavorful as I was expecting, but it was still decent. I enjoyed the crisp veggies that were in the soup. Noodles were a bit thin and maybe overcooked where they were kind of breaking? Not sure. The chicken was quite tender and soft, but not full of flavor as I was expecting. Overall it was a bit bland but not horrible. I give the actual dish a 3/5 but I don't see myself coming here during lunch hour and waiting more than 30 min to be seated for bland curry noodle soup. 

Although I did notice that the people that worked there had "garlic noodles" displayed on their shirts so I'm assuming that's their specialty. I did see a lot of people ordering the garlic noodles. Ok maybe if I'm ever curious to try their garlic noodles I'll come back. :P
author: Rehana K.

description: 2 words: Garlic noodles. The garlic noodles are the best I've ever had. Be sure to go early because the restaurant fills up with people fast. It's also a bang for your buck because $11 for a heaping plate of garlic noodles and 5 spice chicken in the Financial District is unheard of. Sure if you want cheaper you can  go to Chinatown but this stuff is really good and can be split into 2 comfortable meals. Definitely coming back!
author: Christina N.

description:
**4.5 STARS**

My NEW "go-to" spot for lunch! 

My co workers and I were at the point of getting sick of all the restaurants around the neighborhood so we finally managed to try a new spot and I think we're all sold!

Came in here around 12:30 and there was a wait - not too bad though. 

We ordered the following:
