» ME =  beef with garlic noodles = solved! It came within minutes! The garlic noodles wasn't that strong... which was good so that the people around work won't complain =) The beef was tasty and cooked just right. Portions was huge as well... can't complain on that!

» boss = got the same thing as me and she said that she also liked the garlic noodles not being strong and over bearing.

» coworker = pork chops with rice = she mostly ate the pork b/c she's in the "no rice" diet as much as she can =) other than that, she liked it.

Overall, portion + taste + pricing were my main factors that I became a fan. $10.50 for all that goodness... fast and piping hot... can't beat that. Definitely much cheaper than Osha... 

Can't wait to try their pho for this coming rainy/winter season!

I'll definitely be back!

PS: weird name for a Vietnamese spot... Also, they're the same company as PPQ.
author: Cath M.

description: Solid, if unspectacular lunch spot in downtown SF. You know what you're getting if you come here...quick service (very rushed though) and a hot plate of garlic noodles and five spice chicken (is there anything else to even get here)? The garlic noodles are tasty, and buttery, and the chicken well cooked. Could use more flavor or more seasoning here/there, but the chicken is tender, and the portion size generous. Swing by early, as if you come later be prepared for a line out the door.
author: David H.

description:
Bland vermicelli bowl, super crowded during lunch, kind of a rip off. 
$13+ for vermicelli, one imperial roll and slice pork...guess I'm used to downtown prices for better food since I used to get the same thing for $7 at a Geary St. restaurant. But I guess all the lunch establishments are cashing in on the new kids on the block lunchetteers.
author: L v.

description:
Finally tried this place after seeing long lines for months.  None too crowded today, which made it handy for a quick lunch.

Tried the grilled pork noodle bowl, added an Imperial Roll, and closed with an iced coffee.  The noodle bowl was pretty large, filled with meat, veggies and loads of noodles.

Imperial Rolls were 3 star, but I always like trying that item at new places just in case they rival my beloved (and deceased) Tu Lan.  Coffee was pre-mixed and served in a tumbler--a little out of the norm but OK when it came to the end result.

I will be back, the garlic noodles seem to get a lot of good press and there are many options to sample.
author: Patrick S.

description:
Perilla is known for its garlic noodles - it's crazy heavy but tasty! I almost had a food coma after but what's the point of life if you don't get to live dangerously? I had the vegetarian option, but I heard good things about the Five Spices chicken one. 

The portions are good especially since it's so heavy. In hindsight, it would probably have been better to split into 2 meals - but it's hard to think straight when you're stuffing your mouth full of garlic noodles. 

I came here for lunch with some co-workers and the line can get pretty long. The place is usually packed around lunchtime, so prepare for a wait.
author: Don L.

description:
Great lunch spot! Met a friend here around 12:30 and it was pretty crowded but our name was called after about 10 minutes of waiting so not bad. We were given water and menus as soon as we were seated, ordered quickly and got our food in a very timely manner. I got the five spice chicken and garlic noodles and my friend got vermicelli and prawns. The portions were HUGE, I'll easily get two meals out of it and the food was delish. 

Perfect for a quick, easy, sit down lunch spot. I'll be back for sure.

Side note -- if you want to miss the lunch crowd show up around 1, the majority of the rush was over by then.
author: Lizzy U.

description:
More like... 3.5 stars...

Came here with a friend for lunch.. the wait was long, about 30 minutes for a party of 2. then again, it's expected since its in FiDi at 12PM. Finally got seated, we both ordered the garlic noodle with 5 spice chicken (10.50). Took a while for it to come out....

Pretty generous portions. I didn't love the noodles, but for some reason i couldn't stop eating it. lol. I like my noodles more al-dente and with tons of garlic... this place is more soft with tons of butter... lol... the Chicken was good! the skin as crispy, the meat could use a bit more flavor, I had to keep dunking mine in fish sauce. More veggies would be great too... since it's all carbs and protein...

Service was quick enough. The reason why it takes so long is because of the customers. They're done eating, but still insists on sitting at the table. Check paid. Still sitting. Dishes collected. Still sitting. Table wiped down. Still sitting... i Know the employees are trying to hint for them to leave, but nope. still sitting. sigh... i mean you know there are so much ppl in line... if you're done, move on. Go chat at a coffee house and let us starving people eat!!!

All in all, I will swing by next time to try their curry chicken and pork!! Yummy!! =]
author: Judy W.

description:
Love love love this place! I frequent this location at least once a week. I usually use this as my cheat meal if I inhale the garlic noodles. 

Shrimp Garlic Noodles #nom
Shrimp Vermicelli #nom
author: M E.

description: I have been here twice and always loved the food. Both times, I've ordered the vermicelli bowl with five spice chicken. I love the addition of the mint in the lettuce/sprout/green onions mix, definitely adds an extra note of freshness. The chicken seems to be pan fried, not grilled, which makes the skin extra crispy, but takes it down a nothing on the health scale. The place is a great lunch spot, although during lunch rush, make sure to go early or there's a 10ish minute wait. The service is about what you would expect for a restaurant like this -- efficient and minimal.
author: Alice W.

description: Super solid garlic noodles and veggies. I loved the shiitakes, cabbage, and glass noodles. Little expensive for noodles though. $11 for veggie noodles. The guy next to us had cold vermeceli noodles though- I think I'll try those next time!
author: Megan B.

description:
Ordered the garlic noodles with pork chops. Yummm! Garlic noodles aren't too garlicy, and taste absolutely amazing. Plenty of pork chops too, although most of it are fat ... meh. My friend got the five spice chicken and it tasted great! So I'm definitely getting that next time. Huge portions, fast service, definitely coming back soon.
And oh, make sure you have mints with you for after. Or else your garlicy breath will chase your coworkers and vampires away.
author: Xin W.

description:
So the only reason this joint caught my attention was the long line that is there every single day during lunch time. If you want to avoid a line you have to come at around 11:30 AM or past 1:00 PM otherwise expect to wait for a bit. So I went one day with a friend and was able to sneak in there right before the huge lunch rush. We are seated promptly and menus brought over quickly. We decided to share the dishes and order the Garlic noodles with Pork and the Vermicelli with the Five Spice Chicken. 

The Garlic noodles are just as good as everyone raves about on yelp. The buttery garlic flavor is perfect and the pork was a wonderful compliment to the noodles itself. I know a lot of people go for the Five Spice chicken on the Garlic noodles but definitely recommend you try the pork. It basically tastes like bits of marinated Korean bbq. How can you go wrong with marinated meats Korean BBQ style and garlic noodles? You can't. The vermicelli was a nice alternative to not have something as heavy as the Garlic noodles. The five spice chicken on this was great. The skin was crispy and the chicken was tender so definitely NOMS. 

This place is a nice spot to grab lunch in SOMA but definitely on the more pricey side for what you are buying. With that said though, still a joint that I would come to often if the line wasn't so darn long!
author: Dan M.

description:
I am a big fan of garlic and was super excited when one of my coworkers suggested this restaurant for lunch today. I ordered the Beef Garlic Noodles and also got to taste the 5-spice chicken off of my coworker's plate. By no means was the food bad.

The noodles had a consistent texture and a nice subtle garlic taste. Personally, I would have preferred a much stronger garlic flavor. My coworker thinks the restaurant may have made the flavor less powerful in the last year to serve a larger customer base. The beef and chicken were both very well cooked today, but the broccoli was not.

Overall, I enjoyed having lunch here. However, I don't think I will be going back for what you're getting at approximately $15 per entree (w/ tax and tip).

Pros:
- Noodles were consistent
- Meat (beef + 5 spice chicken) was prepared very well

Potential Improvements:
- The restaurant could give an option to ask for more garlic (maybe incorporate it into their menu
- Price point is a bit high, but that is kind of expected for a restaurant in the financial district
author: Jeff M.

description:
Came to this place recently after hearing some of my friends talk about their garlic noodles. This place definitely was a better alternative than the one on Irving, simply because of one reason. Easier to find parking. I also didn't realize that they close on the weekend, so just a heads up!

Me and my girlfriend tried the 5 spice chicken with garlic noodles, which came with 3 egg roles as well; way more than what you'll get at other pho places for a rice plate. I tried the same dish, but substituted grilled pork for the 5 spice chicken. When the food came around, took about 15 minutes or so, it smelled freakin delicious. I love absolutely love garlic! However, my first bite of the garlic noodles came not as I expected. I kind of expected a little more for the amount that they advertised about it. The 5-spiced chicken on the other hand was so pretty darn goood. In my opinion. It was moist in the inside, yet the skin was perfected fried on the outside. On another note, the service was  quite amazing as the waiter came to our table to refill water every 5 minutes. Filled our cups even when our water was full. 

Price: Each plate was about $10.25 each, which came out like around $24 total after tax. Pretty decent for the size of the dish.

Food: The garlic noodles did not have that intrinsic buttery flavor, nor the pure overwhelming infusion of garlic. 

Probably would come to this place again if I didn't have another option around the area.
author: Michael W.

description: Great spot for Ethnic but not dumpy lunch. My sliced pork "bun" (sans vermicelli) was tasty and cheap. Extra fish sauce please!
author: Andrew K.

description:
I came here twice for lunch! I got the garlic noodles both times. One was with grilled chicken and the other was curry chicken.
Both were very tasty and noodles were moderately garlicky and not very oily. They gave decent amount of food and they were extremely fast. 

I will come back when I'm craving for garlic noodle!
author: Ruxin H.

description:
I like this spot, I'm a fan of garlic noodles.  The portions sizes for are really big.  I mean I can pretty much eat the entire plate in one sitting, smh (but I'm always hungry cause of working out constantly), but I've seen some people get a couple meals out of it.   I've tried the pork, beef and curry chicken and spicy chicken plates (shared with a couple people)  I think I'd order the pork more than the others, but that's probably cause I'm tired of chicken.  The curry chicken was good to, it has a nice kick to it.  

It's about $11 a plate, the place gets really crowded around 12-1 with lines out the door.  I would suggest you pre-order and pick it up unless you get there early enough to sit down and enjoy it.
author: Jeremaine R.

description:
This is a popular option for lunch, so wait might be long. I had to wait about 10min coming here on a Tuesday before noon lunch rush. At least the food came out fast (maybe too fast...). I got the Pork chops with garlic noodles. There's a very decent helping of noodles, and wasn't disappointed by the food overall. Service is so-so. The waiters aren't exactly respectful, but they aren't rude either. They're just kind of there to get you your food.

Would I go again? Yea I would. It's still a great deal for lunch in SF, just go earlier so you're not stuck waiting.
author: Willis L.

description:
garlic noodles so damn good.

I did have to go buy a toothbrush and toothpaste on my way back to work, but def worth it.
author: Jimming C.

description:
Let's cut to the chase, I do not recommend this restaurant and I won't waste your time with a lengthy review.

Ordered the "pork chops noodle soup" and regretted the decision upon its arrival at the table. The beansprouts and cilantro had seen better days as they filled a bowl of bland soup accompanied by noodles that appeared to be cut, making it difficult for chopstick users albeit probably intended for the population of fork users.
author: Dennis L.

description: I usually come here for the Curry Chicken with Garlic Noodles which is my favorite dish here.  Garlic noodles are really good and i love their Curry!  I just tried their Curry Chicken Noodle Soup.  It was good, but i'd rather stick to the garlic noodles w/ Curry Chicken.  Don't forget to add the imperial rolls! I'll be back again.
author: Joane B.

description: Came here for lunch with a party of 5 on a Thursday around 1pm. The place was full, but was winding down since people were leaving. I have been to this place before but a different location. They work fast-paced but don't refill your waters :( ordered the five spice chicken with garlic noodles for $10.50 which is bout $2 more than their Irving location. The garlic noodles was a huge portion and the chicken was good. The garlic noodles are a bit bland today and I had to use the fish sauce for even their broccoli. Nonetheless, chicken was good, missing a bit of crisp to the skin, but decent. Left very full and a check of about $65 for 5 people. My friend had their beef noodle soup and it was bland broth so I don't think I'd be ordering that the next time I come. Service is quick and food comes out quick. If it's full, you'll need to sign in for seats.
author: Amanda C.

description:
I had the five spiced chicken vermicelli, which comes with lettuce. For about $11, it was kind of overpriced. Guess, I don't believe in paying overpriced Vietnamese food. There was so much noodles and received a small slab of chicken.

Although, the chicken was moist and well flavored. Boy, it can get crowded!
author: Nhung T.

description: Food is good and portions here are huge. The seating area is a bit crowded and i wish they had a better way to manage the lunch crowd. Sometimes waitress never show up to give the check because they are so busy and people end up waiting in the table, causing the wait line even more longer.
author: Shwetz M.

description:
BEST Garlic noodles in the city, holy cow. Stumbled in with a friend for lunch and had the garlic noodles with prawn. It was a huge portion and absolutely delicious. Tied it with a Thai iced tea and I was in heaven.

Don't know where to go for lunch? Well, now you do. HERE!
author: Krista K.

description:
This review is for their noodle soup.

Came here during my lunch break as I was in need of some hot broth, and this was the closest restaurant to me when I yelped "pho". Restaurant was near full with the typical FiDi lunch rush crowd, but I was able to get seated within a couple minutes.

Saw that near everyone had ordered either a rice plate or the garlic noodles, which seems to be what this place is known for, but I wanted soup and that's I was going to get. 

My first indication that it was going to be disappointing was the fact that it wasn't called "pho",  just "noodle soup" with your choice of chicken, shrimp, beef, etc., but against my better judgment I ordered the Noodle Soup with beef for $11.25.

Came out a few minutes later with bean sprouts and onions already added in, and a plate of cooked beef on the side. 

The soup was incredibly bland and utterly unimpressive. The broth tasted like generic chicken broth diluted with water. The only consolation was the beef, which was pretty good. I imagine it would've gone great with the garlic noodles.

All in all, I definitely would not consider the noodle soup worth $11.25. It doesn't really try to be pho, but whatever it is should not even be a menu item.

1 star for the noodle soup, +1 for the beef.

Maybe I'll come back to check out the garlic noodles.
author: Kevin P.

description:
Always a solid place to go when craving great garlic noodle dishes in the FINI/SOMA area.  Price is decent, great taste, and you get served very quick.

Not exactly the restaurant that you might get to know the workers, but I can see that they work hard so that they can serve a huge number of customers.
author: William Y.

description:
The Thai Iced tea is so good here, but they are famous for their Garlic Noodles and those were awesome too. 

The Chicken was a tad bit greasy but the noodles and iced tea definitely took that off my mind :)
author: Dejanna H.

description:
Sometimes you just have to have your fill of garlic noodles. Although this can be dangerous if you are going to a meeting right after lunch. But if you have the time and the cajones to blow out fire all over everyone else then this might be the stop for you. It's not nearly as good as garlic noodles at Crustaceans or Thanh long. But it's not supposed to be. It's a quick and convenient and decently priced place for a fix. You can get the real stuff some other time.

The combos here range from $8 - $12. Good serving sizes. I like the garlic noodles and five spice chicken as my go-to. I like ordering to go and eating it somewhere else. We have ordered this a few times for office functions too. If you decide to eat here come before 11:30 or after 1pm to avoid the crowds. They can only seat about 30-35 people so it can get backed up. You can also order the garlic noodles alone if you just need an emergency fill of garlic.

I am rating it a 3 because I've had really delicious garlic noodles. But at the same time this place has it's purpose and they serve their purpose well. I must say that the five spice chicken is delicious and cooked perfectly. I almost think they should make it their specialty.
author: Ryan C.

description: Super fast and friendly service is nice in a downtown venue. I read a lot about the garlic noodles so I ordered me a bowl. Bowl was massive which I expected. It didn't have a ton of flavor which I did not expect. I wouldn't go back for these but other menu items did look good as well.
author: Tera K.

description: The best garlic noodles I have ever had! I usually grab to-go, and there isn't much room to stand, but its fairly quick. Those noodles are soo good and buttery. Adding beef or five spice chicken just makes it all the more delicious, although the noodles themselves are a meal amongst themselves.
author: Bryan M.

description:
Had lunch with a friend, she is leaving back to school soon - so we wanted to catch up and have some lunch at Perilla. 

Today I tried to break the routine of the BBQ beef with Vermicelli noodles, by ordering the BBQ Beef with Garlic Noodles, they came with a side of fresh broccoli that was steamed yet crisp. 

I guess I could have tried anything else on the menu besides the BBQ Beef, but it's always good to me. What can I say but that I'm a lady who knows what she likes...
author: Rebekah T.

description:
My two friends and I all ordered the Garlic Noodles with Five Spice Chicken.

The chicken is pretty delicious, though the garlic noodles seem slightly dry. I would have liked it with more garlic or more sesame oil green onion toppings on it.

Overall, very large filling meal. Would definitely come back again if I'm just looking for a good, quick, casual meal.

Definitely recommend ordering an extra side of the fish sauce.

IN TERMS OF DATE SPOT:
a bit too loud during lunch time to hear anyone say anything really.
Otherwise, it's a nice casual place to grab lunch.
author: Vi T.

description:
I was duped too by some of the reviewers. They DO NOT serve Pho. The only noodle soup dish is some chicken broth dish.

I ordered the 5 Spice Chicken Vermicelli. It was actually quite good.

The service is lousy here.

For a quick bite to eat at lunch in downtown when you're working, it works.

Seems like people rant about the garlic noodles, I'll have to try that next time.

Overall my feeling was 'eh, it's ok'. I'll have to try this place again on another day.
author: Doug R.

description: Love my five spice chicken with garlic noodle. I never order anything else. It's super garlicky so watch out u might be having garlic breathe for a few days. Decently priced but long long line if you don't come early say 11am by noon good luck waiting for a table and they won't sit u if all ur party is not there. Customer service not the best but hey they get the order right and the food comes out quick and half way through ur meal ur check is on ur table so win win I suppose. Will come back not weekly but occasional when in craving.
author: Linda S.

description:
Dear laaaaawd please arm yoself with a pack of gum bc you will be smelling like those goddamn delicious garlic noodles for the rest of your life! Came here for lunch with my sisters and we all got variations of their garlic noodles. 

I decided to embody all that is SF and go for the vegetarian plate of garlic noodles... why did I do that... I saw my sister's five spice chicken with garlic noodles and holy crap I've never regretted my decision as fast as I did! 

It gets crowded in here especially during lunch so be ready for a wait especially if you have a big party aka more than 2 people. But shout out to the owners for being so nice and accommodating!
author: Jo L.

description:
Sad that I found out about this place only shortly before moving out of FiDi for work, especially since I always craved garlic noodles for lunch :(

I usually order the garlic noodles and five spice chicken.  I was pleasantly surprised by the chicken, it had a nice crunch to it along with being delicious.  I only wish it came with more veggies since the chicken and garlic noodle portion is pretty large.  One order always turns into two meals for little ol' me.
author: Jane N.

description:
Quick, generous portions make this an ideal lunch spot.

I love garlic noodles, as they combine my two favorite things.  This place does it right with delicious proteins. 

The portions are large, so definitely share it.  The 5 spice chicken is flavorful and tasty.  The spring noodles are crispy and delish.

A perfect casual lunch spot that is decently priced, but also gets you in and out quick..
author: Natalie G.

description:
There's a ton of lunch options in downtown San Francisco.  Most are either quick sandwich places with no seating and no service or really expensive places for expensive account lunches.  This is neither -- $10-12 dishes for lunch, and they have real service, real plates, real silverware, and so on.  

Go with the garlic noodles and a protein; it's clearly what everyone orders.
author: Zachary R.

description:
I've never heard of five spice chicken being a Vietnamese dish until I moved to SF and saw it in almost every restaurant! So odd to me, but I guess I don't mind it because it's so freaking good and Perilla does a good job of it. 

The chicken is tender and juicy, while the skin balances it out with its crispiness. With their garlic noodles though, its a hit or miss - sometimes its flavorful and sometimes it can be very bland. I think to bring out the full flavors of the chicken, it's best to eat it with just plain rice. Boring, I know - but trust, the chicken is what you come for anyway! 

They give a decent portion for around $10 that always leaves me in a food coma after lunch. I've never sat in the restaurant to eat because it gets really packed around lunchtime so I suggest taking it to go!
author: V L.

description: Not bad if it weren't for the dead insect in my Chicken Curry... If it weren't for the extra protein, it would have been a 3. They may be very good, but that was my first time and likely going to be my only.
author: Ian F.

description:
This place is not bad, but like all Americanized Vietnamese restaurants I've tried, woefully inferior to its authentic counterparts. 

First of all, I'm not sure how garlic noodles came to be so popular in these types of establishments because I never ate them growing up, nor saw any restaurants serve them in Vietnam. But here they are, and like the name, these noodles don't play when it comes to garlic. Your breath will stank after them so bring some gum or breath mints for after.

Since this location is literally right next to my office, I've tried several of their Noodle/RIce plates with different varieties of meat, including beef, pork, and their signature five-spice chicken. None of them have been amazing and the only thing "Vietnamese" about them is that they are served with Nuoc Mam (fish sauce). For the high price point, the dishes are way too salty, oily, and heavy. 

Nevertheless, this place remains packed during lunchtime so if you feel the need to impress your colleagues with some ethnic food, definitely come well before noon as they do not take reservations.
author: Sophia V.

description:
I'm really between a 3 and 4 on this, but I keep coming back here every now and then when I'm in a non-Paleo mood.  My favorite go-to: Five Spice Chicken w/ Vermacelli.  I'll admit, the chicken thaws out in a bowl in a sink behind the kitchen, and I'm fairly certain that something like that would be frowned upon by the Health Department.  That being said.....I've never gotten sick from anything I've eaten at Perilla, so in this one isolated incident, no harm, no foul.  The lunch hour is absolutely INSANE and I've never seen this place without a line and people waiting outside.  My recommendation would be to get the order to go and go across the street and sit at the park on a nice day.  The dipping sauce that you get with the chicken is your standard Vietnamese sauce, but somehow, the combination of it all seems to make me devour the plate in less than 20 minutes.  I don't want to make a habit out of this place since it's probably an unhealthy lunch choice, but it's definitely a good place to order from if you're looking for a to go spot.

Side note: They no longer take AmEx, so plan accordingly!
author: Lisa I.

description:
i love eating here for lunch. the portions are generous and the garlic noodles aren't too overwhelmingly garlicy. 

first timers who aren't sure of what to order should try the five spice chicken with garlic noodles. you really can't go wrong. the chicken is cooked to tender perfection, with the skin being the right amount of crunchiness. 

the restaurant itself can get a bit cramped, especially during prime lunch hours, so i suggest ordering to-go to avoid the crowd. i dont think the prices are too high compared to some of the other restaurants in the area. i definitely think the size of the entree makes up for the $$.
author: Andy H.

description: I had the five spice chicken garlic noodles. It was eh in the sense that it was not that flavorful. I was not the biggest fan of the chicken and midway through I just stopped eating the chicken. To be fair I do not like dark chicken, and that's what I got. Would I eat there again? Maybe, but I wouldn't go by myself.
author: Justin C.

description: The Garlic noodles here are really good. It can get crazy busy around noon so make sure to come early. This is not the cheapest place in the area to get lunch, but the portions are giant. I usually end up finishing off lunch during dinner :)
author: Coltin C.

description: Had the Pho here once, which was a mistake.  It had little to no authentic aromatic flavor of what Pho is supposed to taste like (definitely catering to the SOMA demographic).  They are pretty solid on the garlic noodles though.  5-spice chicken is the one to get.
author: Kyle I.

description:
Quick, large portions, $10-12 per dish. I can only finish half then take the rest home. 

Good:
Lemongrass beef over rice
Veggie Garlic Noodles
author: CL S.

description: Came here with my boyfriend who loves five spice chicken. We ended up getting #27, it was sooo good. The thing that I like about Perilla is the staff's attentiveness. The workers are very pleasant and friendly. They are all seem happy to be working there. Will definitely come back. More power!
author: Sharon V.

description:
Coming in, you will be greeted with a strong smell of garlic. Seriously, this place reeks of garlic.

Garlic noodles were alright... not amazing but not bad. 

Can get busy during lunchtime.

Probably best to skip if you're on a date or have a meeting after!
author: Emily C.

description:
Perilla is just fine as a lunch spot. Nothing really stuck out, but nothing was bad either. We were seated immediately and then were able to order pretty quickly, too. I think we were in and out in about 45 minutes, not too shabby for four people

We had a mess of garlic noodles and chicken vermicelli salad. All in all, good food that came out quickly and there was a _lot_ of it. 

The good: quick and dirty.
The bad: paper menus. I hate paper menus. Just...not.
author: Amanda B.

description:
This place is great!  The garlic noodles are to die for.  I do not know why anyone would ever get rice with their meal.  They are moist and full of flavor.  They are not overly salty, and overpowered with a garlic smell.  I usually get the five spice chicken.  I have mixed feelings about the chicken because it is inconsistent.  Sometimes it tastes old and dry- other times it tastes like some damn good chicken.  However, the garlic noodles make up for this in every possible way.  

The egg rolls are an excellent combo with the garlic noodles too.  They are cut to small, bite size pieces with a very good sauce to dip in.  

This place is so busy during lunch time.  So be prepared to wait a while.  Parking is such a hassle since the meter spots are always full.  I would come here around 11am or 1pm.  Avoid the 12:00 rush!
author: Victor L.

description:
Isn't Perilla a method of torture where the victim is strapped to a metal frame and subjected to electric shock? That's what Wikipedia says...oh, that's Parrilla. But I do know a parrilla also refers to a South American outdoor grill, so pardon my confusion as to what to expect with Perilla. There are grilled meats here, but this is a Vietnamese place and a welcome one at that in an area that needs a lot more such eateries.

I'm talking about the area around the soon-to-be-demolished Transbay Terminal where you're out of luck unless you want a bagel or a Lee's sandwich or spend shekels on the likes of Salt House and Town Hall. This used to be a Chinese place that didn't look all that appetizing from the outside, but now it's a bustling lunchtime place with a nice menu of primarily charbroiled meats and garlic noodle dishes.

I've been three times already - and I like the $7.50 Five-Spice Chicken with steamed rice or vermicelli. But I've thrown caution to the wind as well, adding a whole $1.50 for upgrading to garlic noodles. It's tasty and hearty but not enough for me to avoid the $6.50 Charbroiled Pork Rolls, which are wrapped in the soft rice paper. I have to admit one thing - the place originally served pho bowls but no mo. Bring back the pho ...BRING BACK THE PHO! ...this lunchtime lemming needs some pho in this 'hood.

FOOD - 4 stars...solid Vietnamese in an area that needs more
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...a clean but crowded lunchtime spot, sometimes a wait
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...quite speedy...sometimes suspiciously so
TOTAL - 4 stars...love the garlic noodles but I want mo...I mean I want pho
author: Ed U.

description:
I use to go here a lot to get the vermicelli noodles. It was pretty good and close to my office so it use to be the "go to" place for lunch. Then I started to notice that they kept increasing their prices. At one point, when the beef vermicelli cost me $12 (and that's without the fried egg and no imperial roll) I never came back.  

It's sad that it has come to this but I cannot justify paying $12 when there are other Vietnamese options in the area. The little food truck just down the street charges $6. The international food court on Bush charges $8 with the imperial roll!  

Sorry but not everyone working in FiDi is making high salaries. Yes, hard to believe.
author: Tomy T.

description:
Cold take out with cold attitude.

Called my order in and came in 10 minutes later as requested and of course my food wasn't ready.  No big deal. 

After another 5 minutes of waiting I starded watching the take-out orders like a hawk including the larger man that got not just noodles but also a second dish of what looked like eggrolls.  He didn't appear happy that he had to pay 10 cents for a bag.

I then saw a similar looking order come out, a dish with noodles and one with eggrolls and I started wondering if they accidentally made his order twice.  After 10 minutes a woman showed up and paid and the eggrolls were gone.

The cashier then looked at the lone dish of noodles and looked confused.  After checking the ticket and called out my name.  I told him that my order had been sitting there for 10 minutes and that I'd like a fresh order.  He told me, "No, this was just made."  

I again told him that the dish had come out at the same time as the lady's eggrolls and that it had been sitting for 10 minutes.  Once again he told me that I was wrong.

I then stated that if you he insisted on calling me a liar he wouldn't have my business in the future.  He smiled.

This is the last time I'll be eating luke warm pork chops or cold noodles from Perilla.  I guess hot food and actually checking the orders when they come out is too much to ask for.
author: Chris L.

description: Yum!! The garlic noodles are so good! I had the 5-spice garlic noodle. Wasn't sure if its Vietnamese or Singaporean but when it tastes this good, you don't really care. The chicken was crispy and super flavorful. The noodles didn't have an overwhelming garlic taste and that was perfect. Would come back for more, for sure.
author: Jason T.

description:
A place that specializes in garlic AND butter? Sign me up!

At least that's what I thought when I slithered over here with a bunch of friends for lunch. And I even recommended this place because Yelp spoke highly of it. What a shame...

I had the five-spice chicken and my friend has the curry chicken, both of which come with their all-famous garlic butter noodles.

The noodles, even though they look disgusting coming from a huge steamy pot and plopped on your dish, were actually really good. But they seemed like ordinary noodles doused in butter and miniature chunks of garlic--great but not that big of a deal.

What really brought the whole experience to shit is their pathetic excuse for chicken breast. It was low quality dark meat chicken with greasy skin, cooked in the most horrible way you can imagine. The broccoli was flavorless too, and a tad bit overcooked. Needless to say, I did not finish my plate.

The concept is there. But the food quality is definitely lacking.

-----

Distinguishing factor: A Vietnamese restaurant that harnessed the power of garlic, butter, and carbs. But they really need to be careful with their meat and veggie quality.
author: Nick A.

description:
I love garlic. I love noodles. I love butter. Did I love the garlic noodles at Perilla? Ehh, it was more like LIKE. I ordered the garlic noodles and 5 spice chicken to-go. I think I only waited 5 minutes before my order number was called, which really made me question the quality of the food. The restaurant was packed, so I'm glad to have gotten my food so quickly. 

The noodles were good, but tasted really fatty. Which they probably are. If you are on a diet, do not get the garlic (butter) noodles. 

The five spice chicken was alright. It tasted more like 2 spice chicken (not much flavor) and it was soggy, not crispy like Hi-Tea 5 spice chicken. The side of vegetable I got was 3 slices of cucumber (I would much rather have had broccoli). I'm not impressed, but I am really, really full. I better be, after throwing back $10.68 for lunch.

Perilla is A-OK in my book - not somewhere I would want to have lunch everyday because of the price and food, but I'll be sure to come back the next time I feel like being a fatty.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
I tend to love Vietnamese food and was looking for a new lunch meeting spot, so figured I should give Perilla a try. 

Wouldn't mind returning, but would also not recommend it in the future. 

- Veggie stir fry and rice plate was fine but unmemorable
- Pretty cheap at $9ish to sit down
- Super fast; plates came out within 5 minutes
- Very loud and busy; would avoid for future lunch meetings
author: Geoff D.

description:
I read on their menu once saying this place is owned by the same people who own PPQ on Irving. Wow, they've really expanded their business.

Anyhow, garlic noodles aren't a big deal and if this is your first time trying it at Perilla, it might have blown your mind, making you come back here for lunch everyday. Well, Perilla feeds on that notion and overcharges you ($11) for a plate of stir-fried noodles loaded with garlic salt. This being the only garlic noodle place in the FiDi (aside from the An Nam food truck) you don't really have any other options to feed your garlic noodle craving.

This place is mediocre. The service sucks. There is always a line. If you want cheaper garlic noodles, explore the Sunset area or go to Thanh Long on Judah.
author: Cheri S.

description:
The garlic noodles with prawns were delicious!! fried tofu  was great as well! definetly recommend this place. Although, during lunch it gets crowded, take it to go and enjoy in the sun (;

also tried a piece of the 5 Spice Chicken  (so yummy)
author: Isa W.

description:
Great alternative to Crustacean garlic noodles. The 5 spice chicken was very tender and moist. The big surprise was the tofu spring rolls which I fully enjoyed. 

The broccoli in the dish was slightly cold but I liked everything else.
author: Elizabeth N.

description:
Sometimes, you just don't give a fck.

What? Yeah I said it. 

I wake up with that attitude sometimes, walk my ass to work, comb through all my e-mails, and I manage to make it to lunch time with that same mind frame. 

Days like that I go to Perilla where I order the five spice chicken + garlic noodles. If I'm really feeling bad ass, I add a fried egg to the mix. You heard right! All fried everything!

The five spice chicken at Perilla is fan-fckin-tabulous! The garlic noodles? Fan-fckin-tabulous! The fried egg? Just a normal fried egg, but fan-fckin-tabulous! 

I'll even eat the skin on some of the pieces of chicken because I'm really not giving a fck!

Then..... I wake up the next morning and feel guilty and grab a salad for lunch that day and the next few days! But, trust that it is worth it. Just like that expensive girl you're dating, she hurts so good!


Side note: I get it to-go and I eat half for lunch and half for dinner!
author: C C.

description:
p: let's go to perilla for lunch! be here BY 11:30.
c: shut the front door, 11:50 won't work?
(please keep in mind i work maybe 6 long blocks away from perilla...)

p knows best. leaving work at 11:10 a.m. to make the 20 min walk to get there by 11:30 was damn worth it. not to mention we were served, taken care of, and out the door in time for me to make it back without overextending my lunch (i caught the 14 bus back instead of walked, but whatevs.) all this without feeling pressured to leave or eat faster.

i ordered the five spice chicken with garlic noodles. the chicken was tender with skin that had just the right amount of crispiness. the humongous pile of garlic noodles was delish too, and it all made a happy home in my tummy for $10 :) woohoo!
author: Caitlin C.

description: It was my first time coming to this location. Food was well portioned and delicious as always. Some of us ended up sharing.  But not the best place for large groups to have lunch. Also their credit card machine was not working, so a few of us ended up running to the closest ATMs for rescue.
author: Uma M.

description: Got the 5-spice chicken pho and it was sooo good. Exactly what I wanted on a blustery, cold SF day. I admittedly don't normally like pho, but decided to give this place a try. The broth was surprisingly flavorful, as was the chicken. We skipped the line and went straight to the back for takeout, and our orders were filled quite quickly. Will definitely be back!
author: Amanda L.

description: It was a crazy busy day at work and I decided to order some takeout. I needed some beef to get me through the day. So I ordered the beef vermicelli with a side of egg rolls. The eggrolls were crispy, substantial in meat filling, and delicious. Beef was too. As with the garlic noodles I have ordered in the past, the vermicelli in the beef vermicelli plate took up more than half of the takeout box. YEAAAAH all that volume was filled with noodles -- can I get more beef please!?? A little more beef would push me to 4 stars here. Having all those noodles can not be good for you (read -- F O O D  C O M A ) Anyway, for the price paid, what I got did not do what I paid, justice.
author: Michelle T.

description:
A little before 1 PM I saw my youngest brother's name flash on my phone, and I hesitated for a moment, debating the probability of it being just another butt dial.  Seriously, I can't count the number of missed calls that have been followed by some 5 minute long voicemail consisting of them talking with their friends about what they'd do in the event of a zombie apocalypse.  

Feeling curious, I decided to pick up; and, as it turned out, they were just 2 blocks away at our Dad's office, and Daddy dearest was wondering if I could take them out to lunch because he just realized that he had a meeting to go to in less then 10 minutes.  (Yes, folks... write that one down and feel free to use it on your eldest child once they start working.)  Being the super-duper daughter and big sis that I am, as well as the possessor of a growing list of places to try having just started a new job in SF, I picked up the little bros and headed to Perilla, walking down Mission from Fremont.

First tip?  Do not enter in the very first door following the entrance to Porticos.  That first glass door will lead you into a small entryway that'll put you face-to-face with a glass door through which you will see a staircase leading up to some office or another.  How do I know this?  Well, I tried opening that glass door, experienced some shock when I realized it was locked and that there was a buzzer to the left, experienced some disgust as I thought "The garlic noodles here can't be THAT good.  What kind of a restaurant would make customers BUZZ their way in"... and then a huge wave of embarrassment and shame, the degree to which I haven't felt since I peed in my pants in the 1st grade, as I realized that this wasn't in fact the entrance to the restaurant, but rather, to someone's office.

I totally wanted to bolt to a different restaurant because I'm sure everyone sitting near the HUGE GLASS WINDOWS saw my EP-IC FAIL, but the little bros really wanted to try garlic noodles so I had to slink in, grateful for the dim lighting that hid my beet-red face.  

The restaurant was about 3/4 full, with a healthy amount of people waiting for take-out (always a good sign).  We were seated immediately, and given water and menus.  Their menu is pretty simple, but I've actually come to appreciate places that know what their strengths are and focus on doing those things really well.  When the waiter came around, we ordered their shrimp rolls (3 in every order) - $7.25, and 3 orders of garlic noodles - $11.75/each (one with beef for the youngest , one with curry chicken for the older one and one with shrimp for me).    

The shrimp rolls and accompanying peanut sauce were good, but not great.  Simply put, they were an adequate placeholder before we got to try the legendary garlic noodles which definitely met my expectations and are worthy of all the hype... until you start getting down to the last 1/4 of what they dump on your plate.  

From where I was sitting I could watch as plate after plate of meat was taken from the kitchen to this small assembly area near the beverage refrigerator.  Once there, another woman would open up a rice cooker and then pile the garlic noodles on.  I know that this place can get pretty busy, and that it might not be realistic to expect the noodles to be "fresh" and made upon order, but having them at only slightly above room temperature was not that appealing.  You have to realize that what makes these noodles really good is the BUTTER... and I don't know about you, but the same butter that is freakin' ah-mazing as it melts on a fresh-from-the-oven piece of cornbread, is positively disgusting right from the refrigerated stick.  The same principle applies to these noodles.  They're good when you first start plugging away since they're still warm from the cooker, but as time passes, well, it quickly starts losing its appeal.  As far as the meat went, it came in at a 1:4 ratio to the noodles.  I mean, could they make it any less apparent that Perilla could just as easily be renamed "Garlic Noodle House"?  Anywho, the shrimp and beef were great, while the curry chicken was just so-so, swimming around with chunks of potato in a thin curry sauce.  

All in all, I'm a fan of garlic noodles, but I'd much rather learn how to make it myself so that it'll be nice and hot rather than coming back to Perilla.
author: Iona C.

description: We ordered curry chicken soup and Charbroiled prawns. Food was fresh and really good and i would highly recommend prawns
author: Vaaruni D.

description:
Had lunch here today.  Food is still good but they committed the 2 deadly sins of the restaurant business - they raised their prices AND made their portions smaller.  Listen I have no problem paying more because eating out is truly a luxury but shame on you for putting on the screws to the customer.  There was barely any shrimp and chicken in our rice and garlic noodle dishes.  I think there were maybe 6 skinny bordering on scrawny shrimp?  The veggie side was exactly only little broccoli next to the rice or noodles.  I guess that's a "side."  The food doesn't look like what's posted here anymore!

I guess this isn't hurting their business since the place was packed.  However service could be better.  We asked for bowls so we can share our dishes.  The guy left and never came back. I had to personally march up to the front counter and helped myself to my own bowls.  

Well I may be suckered once but never again.  I've eaten my last meal here.
author: Wendy H.

description:
Decent.

I came here with my co-workers for lunch. Plenty of tables and there is a sign in sheet for lunch. The waiter calls your name and seats you. We weren't given a menu right away. We ordered grilled pork spring rolls and imperial rolls. I could make better spring rolls, but the grilled pork was very tasty. Imperial rolls were hot and fresh out of the fryer. It was much smaller than I've had at other places. Although, I rather eat an egg roll. As for the entree, I ordered the garlic noodles with five spice chicken. It came with fish sauce and I felt like the fish sauce was over powering over the garlic noodles. I wished I had ordered rice instead. However, the portion is huge and ate the leftovers for dinner.  If I were to come here again, I would try the soup noodles but it looked plain.
author: Jennifer D.

description:
*Sigh* If you "think" you know how Vietnamese food should taste like, Don't come here!  This is not it!  How can such a flavorful cuisine be so bland?! We tried 5 spiced chicken, chicken curry, noodle soup, pork with garlic noodle and EVERTHING tasted bland (perhaps pork was ok).  It's as if the chef decided to dliute everything down to save ingredients.

We didn't get to taste beef and pork chop because they ran out.  Perhaps that says something, but still, I won't be back to try those out.

Sorry.
author: YJ H.

description:
We came here after 2 pm  for lunch today and the seasoned vegetables were all gone. So the waitress brought me a side  order of garlic noodles as an apology and they were so good!

We all had Vietnamese iced coffee, excellent

And the others ordered garlic noodles with beef and one with chicken

I also ordered the shrimp Summer rolls with peanut dipping sauce (as my second choice when I found  out they were out of seasoned veggies ). They were good, too

And just when it was over I spilled my water everywhere as it went flying out of my hand; the waitress was so nice about it, since I also managed get her wet too......

........I've gone back a few times and they are always out of the seasoned vegetables. I give up!

March 18, 2016

Finally, they had the seasoned veggies (they did have to check tho) and while they were good, wow, it's pricey cause it's mostly cabbage.  The curry chicken was a better deal.
author: Foodlover B.

description: Garlic noodles puhleeez! Larger portions than the Sunset location, but also pricier. However, that's expected in FiDi. I will definitely be visiting more often since my office is very close by!! :) Oh, come earlier than noon because it gets busy!
author: Michelle L.

description:
There's NOTHING better than coming back to the office REEKING of garlic...

Why you may ask? Well for starters, no one will want to come near you, which means you can hide in your cube or office for the rest of the day; no one nagging and bothering you in turn means higher productivity! A win-win situation for all...

My friend who works nearby has been raving about Perilla, so I came here yesterday with him. He arrived a little after the lunch rush at 1:15 PM and was able to immediately snag a table for us.

FOOD:
*Papaya Salad w/ Beef: OMG! One of the BEST papaya salads I've ever had. The perfectly julienned papaya and was mixed with basil and carrots and topped with peanuts, fried shallots, and grilled beef. The beef was perfectly grilled. It was tender, moist, and very well seasoned; savory with a slightly sweet aftertaste. All the ingredients were fresh and crisp and the combination of the veggies, peanuts, fried shallots, and nuoc nam dressing created a perfect balance of salty, savory, sweet, tangy, spicy and various texture combinations from the peanuts and fried shallots. 

*Charbroiled Beef w/ Garlic Noodles: YUMMY! Again, the beef was perfectly grilled and was super tender and flavorful. The lemongrass and garlic flavor was prominent but not overwhelming. It was so well seasoned that there was no need for the nouc nam sauce. 

Although Perilla is part of PPQ Crab Dungeness Island, I can tell there was a difference in their garlic noodles. Perilla's version is more soft with a slight bite to it and it's more buttery as opposed to garlicky; while PPQ's is more al-dente, oilier, and has a more distinct garlic flavor. Nevertheless, you can't go wrong with butter and garlic, so I can't say I like one more than the other. 

My friend ordered the five-spice chicken (dark meat) which I tried a piece of and it was DELISH!!! The chicken was perfectly grilled producing a very crisp skin (as if it was fried) and the meat was moist, tender, and very flavorful. You can really taste each component of the five-spices: the star anise, cinnamon, clove, pepper, and fennel which produce the perfect balance of sweet, sour, bitter, pungent, and salty. 

Portions are HUGE, so you will definitely have leftovers for the next day. 
 
PRICES:
*Apps: $5.25-$6.25
*Salads: $7.50-$9
*Garlic Noodles w/ Choice of Meat: $9.50-$10.50
*Rice w/ Choice of Meat: $8-$9
*Bun: $8-$9
*Noodle Soups: $9-$10

CCs accepted.

SERVICE:
I can't say, the waiters were the friendliest; but I can say they were fast and efficient. Although it was past the lunch hour rush, Perilla was still at 90% capacity and we got our salad within 3-4 minutes of ordering and then our entrees 2 minutes later. 

AMBIANCE/DÉCOR: 
Simple and minimalist with bare walls and clean wood tables and chairs. There's capacity for approximately 30 people. 

The CON is they're ONLY opened Mon-Fri from 10:30 AM-3 PM which sucks a$$ b/c I no longer work nearby and it's not like I can take long lunches all the time. But, I'll definitely be back and/or go to their Irving Street location. 

My recommendation is whenever you want to be left alone at the office, come to Perilla for their garlic noodles and request it w/ extra garlic! Trust me, you WILL get a lot "accomplished" afternoon! *Wink Wink*
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
Went with a coworker--as someone who has had plenty of asian noodles in my life, I'd say this is a decent place. Noodles could be a bit less soft, more al dente, but honestly they probably make a giant batch for the entire day so that is probably out of the question. The meat is well flavored, though nothing that is mind blowing.

I'd say overall a decent place, but I wouldn't rave about it.
author: Chrissy H.

description:
Solid Asian Fusion food in the Soma District.  I always get the garlic noodles with the 5-spice chicken, and I never regret it.  However it is a little pricey (not the cheapest alternative for lunch).  But if you need a decently nice sit-down place to grab lunch with friends in the city during your lunch break, this is definitely a great place to go!

Tip: beat the lunch rush by coming around 11:45.
author: Austin R.

description:
Slow.  Give yourself at least an hour or get there by 11ish to get a table.  Garlic noodles are the hype here -- don't come expecting pho and beware that other typical Vietnamese fare can't really be spoken for as much as those garlic noodles.  Recommendations from the group:  five spice chicken and tofu were good options.  The portion is hefty for $13/person with tax and tip, so be prepared to eat or take part of your meal to-go!

Note, waiting space is very limited, but do stay close to the door so you can hear if they've called your name.  Also, during the lunch rush, there isn't much "service" -- ask for what you think you'll need upfront and be ready to repeat yourself after flagging someone down.

Will I be back? For group lunches, sure ... but probably not anytime soon.  Thanks for the garlic noodle experience!
author: Jennifer Y.

description:
This is a great place for a sit-down lunch.

Pros:
Quality of food - I had the garlic noodles with five spice chicken and it was delicious considering it was just a weekday lunch.
Fast service - expect to get your food within 5 min of ordering.

Cons:
A bit noisy

TIP: Get there before noon. Otherwise, be prepared to wait 20 minutes.
author: Paul C.

description:
Perilla... It's the drive-thru version of PPQ (minus the crabs and other special dishes).  But when it comes to the garlic noodles w/prawns or papaya salad and other rolls...Perilla's the lunch spot.

It's best to get there before 11:30 or after 1 because it gets really busy and there is no place to wait other than outside. The staff is OK, but there is one waiter that works here AND PPQ (forgot his name) but he's funny as hell and really takes care of you.
author: Resa N.

description:
Speedy service. Even during prime lunch hours, wait was only 15 minutes. 

Unlike the Perilla in the Sunset, this one has friendlier service. Both locations have consistently delicious food. 

A good lunch option in the city.
Try the Garlic Noodles with Five Spice Chicken!

Also, they accepts CC!
author: Lily S.

description:
Try the garlic noodles! They might be the best I've had. Very strong garlic flavor with a good chewy consistency in the noodles. If you aren't a fan of garlic I recommend the vermicelli bowls. As for the meat choice I like the 5 spice chicken.

Lunchtime can get busy. Try to get there at 11:45 am or after 12:30 pm for a shorter wait.
author: Alice J.

description: Noodles are amazing. Chicken was amazing. This is possibly the best noodle place in SF. Also, grub hub does deliveries from here so an added bonus if you live far away
author: Mel P.

description: I feel like this Perilla is not as good as the one on Irving. The food pretty much tastes the same, but there is something different, like the crispiness of the five spice chicken. They also don't have some items at this location that is offered at the Irving location. It gets pretty crowded here during lunch hours. I tried calling ahead for a take out order to save time. But when I got there to pick up my order, I still had to wait about 15-20 minutes for it.
author: Lina C.

description: let me start off by saying I am heart broken... the garlic noodles and prawns were my favorite!! This place get packed too BUT after seeing a coakroach walking around while waiting for my to go order I will never go back. I assume if I saw one walking around in the back by cash register in the middle of the day who knows whats goign on behind the scene. I hope they clean it up!!
author: Athena C.

description:
Randomly found out a friend and I were working within a few blocks of each other and decided to grab a last-minute lunch. We chose to come to Perilla at 11:30 to beat the lunch rush - a good decision! By the time we left at noon there were at least 8 people waiting outside.

The garlic noodles is what you want. Don't even think about it, that's what you're ordering. I got mine with porkchops, my friend got veggies. Both superb and garlicky and buttery and filling. Decent price for the amount of food, but I feel like the same meal would be at least three bucks cheaper in somewhere like North Beach (which is fine if I ever wanted to set foot in somewhere like North Beach.)

The waiter brought our check to the table while we were still eating, which made it easy to pay and give up our table faster to help with turnaround. I had no issue with it!

Quick, cheap(ish), and satisfying lunch. I'd go again.
author: Lia S.

description:
I am officially finished with this place.  I work a block away.  About twice a week I would stop by for a garlic noodle bowl.  On two separate occasions, I watched the server pick up my noodles and scrape them around on the bottom of the huge vat of noodles, picking up loose garlic, excess oil, and burnt noodles.  After receiving the "bottom of the barrel" noodles the first time, I watched the server the second time.  I noticed her doing the same thing, and I asked her to please not pull the noodles from the bottom.  She dumped out my noodles, and then picked up the identical noodles, very angry that I had protested.  Well, if the noodles (which basically amount to spaghetti with garlic and oil) didn't cost $7, then I might not protest.  

I called the manager to let him know.  He was apologetic.  I returned 2 weeks later, hoping to have a good experience.  I did, and returned 2 days later.  The same rude server noticed it was me and said "there are burnt noodles, do you want them or not?"  She then INTENTIONALLY packed me a box of burnt noodles!

I will not be calling the manager to complain again.  Perilla will get the Yelp review that it has earned and I will take my business elsewhere.  You just lost $7 - $15 a week.
author: Heather A.

description:
One of my favorite places for lunch! Their garlic noodles are Amazing - but my favorite is the Curry chicken soup... 
It gets very packed around lunch time so try to arrive no later than 11:$5 if you don't want to waste time waiting....
author: Ella B.

description: Food is good for a quick lunch in the fidi if you're craving garlic noodles. Spring rolls are yum. Sit down lunch at peak for lunch rush is not terribly long. Expect a 10 min wait at max.
author: Gwen K.

description:
I can't seem to get on the bandwagon about garlic noodles from any restaurant.  it's just garlic butter and noodles... 
But this place does do them well; so if you don't like to make them yourself, then this is the place for you!


The 5-spice chicken seems to be the popular meat, but I prefer the pork.
author: Steven F.

description:
My office ordered lunch from here last week. I got the vegetarian spring rolls and the garlic noodle bowl. They give you so many delicious noodles. I had them for lunch and another lunch the next day. I loved the spring rolls. They were fresh and packed tightly with veggies. The dipping sauce was really good too. It gets really packed here for lunch so if you know you don't have much time for lunch, just call your order in ahead of time.

Prices are reasonable. The noodles + rolls came out to a little over $12.
author: Daisy S.

description: Yummy garlic noodles.
author: Michael E.

description:
Around this office this place is not known as Perilla. That's just it's mortal name. Instead it's better known by the mythical name that has been given to this business by Demeter, The Greek Goddess of Harvest, Bread and Grain. According to legend it was Demeter who named this business "That Awesome Garlic Noodle Place".

Believe it or not but Perilla lives up to that name. Get the Five Spice Chicken and Garlic Noodles for take out. It's delicious, fast and euh... delicious.
author: Yoni D.

description:
I have mixed feelings about Perilla....

USUALLY their beef is so tender and rare that it makes me swoon, but I've been here twice in the past 6 weeks and their beef was cut too thick and wayyyyy too chewy. I was so disappointed this past time because Perilla is my go to place for pho when I want nice thin tender beef. I'm giving them the benefit of the doubt, and am hoping when I go back next time that their beef goes back to how it usually is, but not being consistent with the quality of your food is frustrating!

Tip: garlic noodles are great here too.
author: Eliza F.

description: If you're going for a weekday lunch, try to get there by 11:30 if you don't want to wait.  I usually get the vermicelli with pork and add an imperial roll.  Husband usually gets the pork chops with steamed rice.  Everyone gets the garlic noodles there but I prefer having my vermicelli noodles drenched in their fish sauce.
author: Nina L.

description:
Fair warning, this place does not serve pho. Went at lunchtime so waiting for a table is not recommended. Ordered the garlic noodles with 5 spice chicken. Noodles were average, but the chicken was delicious. It was very crispy and flavorful. 

 Went with 3 other people who ordered soup noodles with either pork chop or beef. They also said that the noodles weren't anything special but the meat was done very well. With the noodle soups, they serve the meat on the side rather than in the bowl so the meat maintains its texture and doesn't get soggy
author: Steven N.

description: i ordered prawn with garlic noodle.  there were very few shrimp, aboout 4, not big ones either.  it's not worth the price,around 12-13 dollars.  the restaurant is freezing, they are too cheap to turn on the heater.   feel sorry for the workers, i ordered to go, so only suffered  a little.   a crappy place charging ridiculously high price.   will go  somewhere else for lunch.
author: Lucy J.

description:
Just had my left overs and they were just as good as the restaurant.  Noodles are homemade - thick n soft and super garlicy.  YUM!  The five spice chicken was also yummy.  

Next time I go there, I'm going to try to be a bit difficult and ask if I could get a plate with garlic noodle, chicken, rice, egg, and egg roll.  That would give them 10stars!!!!

Food came back within 2 minutes of orderings! Don't be alarmed, their menu is small and turnover's quick, so the food's still very fresh.

Can't wait to go back!  YUM~!!!!

There's always a lunch crowd, even on Veteran's Day, so come early or have time to wait...although the line moves pretty quickly.
author: Janet L.

description:
Yada yada yada! 3 1/2 stars!? I would have to say 4 1/2 stars so I'll just round up! I came here with some family for lunch earlier. They decided on coming here for lunch and said that it was good so I went with it. We arrived at around 1:30 and there was still a short wait for a table.

Their garlic noodles were the crazy good! Extra garlicky and the noodles were cooked perfectly! Their five spice chicken is also really tasty and crispy. Their five spice chicken salad is also a great dish! Their curry chicken and pork dumplings were okay.

I would absolutely come back again!
author: Darryl P.

description:
I won't be coming back often, because massive amounts of buttery garlic noodles aren't healthy...

But massive amounts of buttery garlic noodles are DELICIOUS, so I definitely recommend them.
author: Jane R.

description:
Had lunch catered for our office. We've ordered form here about five times but this time was really disappointing. 

We received four platters. It was mostly rice. Even the salad was on top of a full tray of rice. The shrimp was on a bed of like 5 pounds of rice noodles. This was suppose to feed thirty people.

I think they wanted it to look like a lot of food, but it was just filler.

Ridiculous.
author: Jeanne C.

description:
Definitely Meh.  

Service was a bit distracted.  Food was mediocre, not great. (curry chicken with rice.)  Water with no ice.  Utensils are all kept on the table in a cup (which I'm pretty sure is against food safety guidelines).  Obnoxiously wobbly table.  Had to move to a different table to avoid the strong urine smell wafting in from the doorway.  (perhaps if they trashed the old, black stained welcome mat outside, they can actually clean the entry way.)

I'd give this place a pass and go somewhere better.
author: Raymond M.

description:
Their garlic noodles are crack noodles.  Seriously.  My stomach told me I was full, but my tastebuds wanted more.. for the sake of my waistline, I had to stop eating.  So delicious - buttery and garlic-y and perfect chewiness.  

Five-spice chicken was tasty and well-cooked, but I definitely thought the beef was better, more flavorful, and surprisingly soft.
author: Joyce H.

description:
Move over Cordon Bleu...there's a new fave 5 spice chicken in town! And this one is served with garlic noodles, oh yeah! 

I have kind of avoided this place since there is always a pack of people waiting outside during lunch time & I just want to eat NOW. I tried to go once with some coworkers but there aren't many large tables & we didn't feel like waiting. So on Friday I came by myself at 11:45, sure that I would get a table right away since it was pre-lunch rush. Nope, still had to wait. That was OK tho, cuz I was fully prepared to stand out there in the cold, dreary weather for as long as it took to get myself a table & try their famous garlic noodles. 

After about 15 minutes I was seated, ordered, & literally TWO MINUTES later a steaming plate of 5 spice chicken & garlic noodles arrived in front of me. What service! 

I attacked the garlic noodles first. Ohh the garlicky buttery flavor! Then the chicken, oh the chicken! The skin was crispy & slightly caramelized & the chicken was moist. I don't usually eat the skin but I couldn't help it. Minus the few minor bits of fat, I ate everything on the plate. And it was a BIG plate of food. 

I went back to work happy, like I just had an attitude adjustment. This is some definite comfort food!
author: Erin S.

description: Okay, gave it another go. Tried the garlic noodles and the pork and 5 spice chicken. Both were pretty darn good. Portions are large. $18 for my portion of lunch. Still a lot!
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
What I Ate
- Garlic noodles with five spice chicken

Would I Go Again?
Yes, but I am not planning my next trip.  The garlic noodles were outstanding--by far the best part of the meal.  The chicken was tender and flavorful; however, it was pretty greasy.   The vegetables were unimpressive--few in number and undercooked.   The garlic noodles were enough to get me to go back again, but I won't make it a weekly or even monthly lunch spot.
author: Ben M.

description: The best Vietnamese garlic noodle place in the City.  And it is worth the wait outside.  I usually order the Five Spice Chicken and garlic noodles.  Yummy!  The service is fast once you get a table but prepare to wait.  I am subtracting one star because the only vegetable you get with the plate lunch is two scrawny pieces of broccoli.
author: Chilly W.

description:
Strengths:
 -Garlic noodles with grilled pork (add a fried egg, and ask for it to be over easy and not overcooked) 

Development areas:
 -The tables next to the doorway get an inconvenient breeze every time someone comes in to the restaurant, which is often
-The fried egg is sometimes too fried, which is why I ask them to make sure it's over easy and not overcooked. Runny egg over those noodles is splendid

How to maintain 5 stars:
-Garlic flavor in the noodles can vary.  Keep the flavor strong and consistent
author: Jason L.

description:
Happy to have Perilla so close to my office!  We got there at 1145ish and there was already a line out the door.  We only had to wait about 10 minutes but people were opting to eat next door so they wouldn't have to wait outside in the cold/wet.

As usual, I ordered the five spiced chicken with noodle soup.  My friend ordered the five spiced chicken with garlic noodles.  The reaction on her face as she ate it was PRICELESS.  I told her beforehand not to get her standard up TOO high as the last time she had garlic noodles was at The House and Perilla only showed 3.5 stars on Yelp.  But, despite me trying to play it down she stopped after one bite, her eyes got wide and said this TOTALLY A FIVE STAR!!  HOORAY!

Service is quick and no fuss.  It's perfect for a quick lunch break without gypping yourself of the quality.  I will def be heading back there on another cold/rainy day.

Expect a regular $10 for a DT lunch, but you will leave FULL.
author: Sandy L.

description:
Serviceable decor, good food, fast service. Good lunch spot for the area - definitely preferable to the horrid Portico food-trough next door. 

To soothe a sore throat, I had the Pork Noodle Soup. The soup base was light, the pork delicious (Vietnamese grilled pork is my favorite!) but overall it was lacking in that extra oomph. I'll have to try the Garlic Noodles next time as every other person in the restaurant was eating it.

Definitely will be back.
author: Karen C.

description:
The garlic noodles are perfection.  Either 5 spice chicken or the stir-fried veggies add a nice complement and some heft.  

The portion sizes are movie theater-esque.  They drop a lot of food on your plate.  I can't imagine eating a whole entree in one sitting, but good to share or for leftovers.
author: Mark F.

description:
Best takeout place within walking distance of my office!
Their veggie garlic noodles are really really good (and the portions are huge).
They also serve it up super-fast, so its pretty convenient !
Not a good idea to eat this for lunch everyday cause it can you make feel a little too full and drowsy afterwards!
This would have been more awesome as a dinner place.. sadly they aren't open for dinner.
author: Aditya M.

description:
I just had to try the garlic noodles that everyone raves about on here. So I ordered it with the 5 spice chicken. You know, gotta be honest, I liked it. The chicken was delicious esp the thin layer of crunchy skin. However, the garlic noodles were average. Unknown to me at the time, I have made this dish at home! It's very simple.. noodles, garlic, some butter. I added some crab meat to mine and voila! garlic noodles. When I first tasted this dish at Perilla, I swear the first thought that came to mind was: ramen noodle! The 5 for $1 at the grocery store. Really, people, this dish is not all that!! It was even on the bland side. And for $10.50 way overpriced. I'm giving this place 3 stars because I didn't hate the dish. My partner had a noodle soup though that he thoroughly disliked ("I felt raped" is what he said). He orderd it with 5 spice chicken also. He said it was just so bland and flavorless. I'll let him review his own experience (I'm thinking he's going to give them 1 star). 

And if you do go, don't pick a table close to the door. People wait in that area with their asses on your table. If you get there after 11:45, prepare to wait. And be surprised at how utterly ordinary this place is.
author: Vol T.

description:
Since I work just a block away from Perilla, I find myself here more than I would if I didn't work so close. I'm mainly giving them a 4 star rating for their delicious GARLIC NOODLES. You can either order the Garlic noodles with a type of meat (chicken, pork, etc.) or you can get a side of Garlic noodles, which is usually what I do. 

The Garlic noodles are pretty much a meal in itself. It's not too strong with the garlic, but can get pretty oily because of all the butter it's saturated in. Not saying that's a bad thing - but just know that if you're going to eat it to account for all the calories you'll be indulging in :)
author: Jennifer R.

description: Don't ever order the noodle soup here.. no flavor to the broth -- however the grilled beef that comes on the side is excellent! Garlic noodles, I've had better as well
author: Calvin C.

description:
I walked in around 1130 with a party of 4 and we were immediately seated, but around 12pm it got really packed, so I would suggest that you come earlier like I did. I ordered the garlic noodles and five-spice chicken and it was superb! The chicken was cooked really well with the skin just as crispy as it should be, and there was ample noodles. I would have liked the noodles to have more garlic though, but garlic lovers like me will never be satisfied.

BUT REALLY, MORE GARLIC!
author: Jason T.

description:
Decent sit down Vietnamese restaurant in the FiDi. There's not many other pho places within walking distance (besides Hi-Tea - which is more fast food-ish).

Head here around 11-11:30 to beat the lunch rush or else you'll find yourself standing outside waiting for 15-20 mins for a table!

Big prawns, fresh spring rolls, most popular dish is the garlic noodles - which I've never tried myself but it seems to be on every single table!
author: Mia N.

description: The 5 spice chicken is super flavorful and moist. Garlic noodles pairs well with it. Garlic noodles by itself tho is a bit bland. All in all, great spot for lunch. There is a wait but the crowd eats fairly quickly.
author: Amy P.

description:
Came here for lunch and got the garlic noodles with seasonal vegetables and tofu. Well... I had about 2 tiny pieces of tofu, and the rest was cabbage and carrots. The noodles were good, you can taste the butter, and the garlic was not too overpowering.

Would have liked it even more if there were more vegetables than just carrots and cabbage, and more tofu.

Service was fast, not friendly.

I would come back if I had a craving for garlic noodles, but I'm hoping next time I won't have a terrible stomachache after eating here.
author: Sarah H.

description:
Bad day at work? Perilla comes to the rescue.

Garlic noodles + five spiced chicken = UTTER CONTENTMENT. 

The papaya salad is really refreshing and overall, everything here is good comfort Vietnamese food. 

They are a part of PPQ, so you can't go wrong at Perilla!
author: G K.

description:
Perilla is quickly becoming one of my new favorite lunch spots.

The food is great and the prices are right.

I've become a huge fan of their "Garlic Shrimp with Vermicelli." The garlic shrimp are massive and flavorful, and I love that the vermicelli noodles are mixed together with fresh greens, peanuts, and topped with sweet sauce.

Perilla's been catching on with the lunch crowd so it's been getting busier - as of late. I highly recommend getting there early or later if you want to snag a table. If not - take-out is quick and easy.

If you're looking for something different in the area - Perilla is it. And I learned recently that it's owned by the same people who run PPQ (hmmmm garlic noodles.....).

Which means that you're in capable hands - because PPQ, like Perilla, always brings the tasty.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
I only eat here when my lunchie coworkers are too lazy to walk over to Hi Tea for pho.

They don't serve pho at this location, but have chicken noodle soup.  I tried this once, but thought the soup was really bland and not enough flavor. 

I gave Perilla a second chance and def like the Beef Garlic noodle they had.  It comes with a plate of garlic noodles and a plate of bbq sliced beef on the side.  Very tasty and flavorful.  

The fried egg rolls taste like any typical Vietnamese restaurant, so you can't go wrong with this item. 

Def my goto garlic noodle beef place in the SOMA! Make sure you go around 11 to beat the lunch rush, cause people do wait in line to get seated here.
author: Chanel L.

description:
Yes, it is quite heavy for lunch and who would want their co-workers to return to the office with garlic noodle breath? 

But....it is a risk I'm willing to take and to make sure I have enough mint at my desk. 

The garlic noodles are buttery and flavorful, it has a real nice texture. I've only had their 5 spice chicken with the noodle so far and I am SATISFIED!! For those of you who misses Hi-Tea's 5 spice chicken, give this place a try and you won't be disappointed.
author: Maggie C.

description: Good food, but probably not worth if for the price. Went for lunch, and service was OK. I'd probably recommend getting lunch to-go if possible.
author: Kyle K.

description: Very bad experience. We ordered three dishes. Unfortunately, we found hair in spring roll and one bug in the noodle soup. They didn't even apology to us. I could imagine how dirty the kitchen it is. I won't go to this restaurant again!!!!
author: Yi L.

description:
This place is really overpriced, but I know many many people would argue that everything in the financial district is overpriced.  Fair enough I guess.

If you really really think about what you're getting with an order of garlic noodles and meat, it's easy to see how high the profit margin must be for this place.  Buying ingredients for noodles is dirt cheap and they mostly give you garlic noodles anyway.

Tried this place once, and I'm probably never going to go again.  Viet food in SJ is half the price and 10 times more delicious.
author: Anna T.

description:
I've been here about 3 times now and I've had pretty good experience every time.

I don't really remember the last time I've eaten garlic noodles, or where it was at, so I don't have much to compare this place to.

This place is famous four their five spice chicken w/ garlic noodles and it's pretty bomb, especially their fish sauce.  Their fish sauce isn't as "traditional", a bit sweeter? but I like it a lot haha.  It's a good lunch options, about $12 (a BIT pricier) but you get a good amount of food.

There's typically a wait if you don't come before 11:30AM, but it's okay if you come after 12:45PM.  Of you could always call and order for pick up!  Take out takes about 15 minutes and it's pretty crowded inside.
author: Willis C.

description:
Perilla was one of my first experiences ever when it comes to Vietnamese food. After a gruelling 2 hour interview at a firm in SOMA, a friend and I decided to grab some quick lunch and chitchat and she recommended Perilla to me.
